pid-online.name: PID-based identification in online services
pid-online.description: Secure identification to an online service using the PID stored in an EUDI Wallet.

pseudonym.name: Use of a pseudonym in online services
pseudonym.description: Interact with digital platforms without revealing your full identity, unless legally or functionally required to.

esignature.name: eSignature
esignature.description: Create advanced electronic signatures with the same legal validity as a handwritten signature.

payment-auth.name: Online payment authorisation
payment-auth.description: Enables online payments to be authorised via an EUDI Wallet.

open-bank-account.name: Open bank account
open-bank-account.description: Enables individuals to open a bank account online using their EUDI Wallet.

mdl.name: Mobile Driving Licence (mDL)
mdl.description: Proof of an individual's right to drive a certain kind of vehicle.

dtc.name: Digital Travel Credential (DTC)
dtc.description: A digital representation of the user's identity document such as an identity card, passport or another travel document.

epc.name: European Parking Card (EPC)
epc.description: Issued to persons with disabilities, recognising the right to certain reserved parking conditions and facilities.

vrc.name: Vehicle Registration Certificate (VRC)
vrc.description: Proves the registration and legal compliance of a vehicle with national and European road transport regulations.

disability-card.name: European Disability Card
disability-card.description: Serves as proof of recognised disability status/entitlement to disability services.

eprescription.name: e-Prescription
eprescription.description: Identify yourself in order to access e-prescriptions stored and presented via an EUDI Wallet.

ehic.name: European Health Insurance Card (EHIC)
ehic.description: Grants access to necessary healthcare when in another Member State.

public-warnings.name: Public warnings
public-warnings.description: Enables trusted public authorities to issue real-time or scheduled warnings and alerts, like for natural disasters.

age-verification.name: Age verification
age-verification.description: Prove you are above a specific age threshold (e.g., over 16, 18, or 21) using a verifiable digital credential.

ticket-pass.name: Ticket or pass
ticket-pass.description: Store, manage, and present digital tickets and access passes, like boarding passes or event tickets.

edu-credentials.name: Educational credentials
edu-credentials.description: Store, manage, and present digitally verifiable education-related credentials, like diplomas and certificates.

student-card.name: European student card
student-card.description: Enables students to store and present their student status.

proximity-id.name: Identification in proximity scenarios
proximity-id.description: Secure in-person identification for services where the transaction requires strong assurance of identity.

representation.name: Natural or legal person representation
representation.description: Enables users to act on behalf of another individual or an organisation using digitally verifiable credentials.

roles.label: Relying Party
roles.description: Entity accepting wallet credentials for authentication/verification

profiles.label: Public Sector
profiles.description: Government bodies, public administration, public services

profiles.label: Private Sector
profiles.description: Commercial entities, banks, private service providers

roles.label: EAA Issuer
roles.description: Entity issuing electronic attestations of attributes

profiles.label: Qualified TSP (QEAA)
profiles.description: Qualified Trust Service Provider issuing qualified attestations

profiles.label: Public Sector (Authentic Source)
profiles.description: Public body issuing attestations from authentic sources

profiles.label: Member State Direct
profiles.description: Wallet provided directly by a Member State

profiles.label: Mandated Provider
profiles.description: Wallet provided under mandate from a Member State

profiles.label: Independent (Recognised)
profiles.description: Independent provider recognised by a Member State

roles.label: PID Provider
roles.description: Member State entity (or designee) issuing Person Identification Data

roles.label: Trust Service Provider
roles.description: Provider of trust services (e-signatures, e-seals, timestamps, etc.)

profiles.label: Qualified (QTSP)
profiles.description: Qualified Trust Service Provider on EU Trusted Lists

profiles.label: Non-Qualified
profiles.description: Standard trust service provider with baseline requirements

roles.label: Conformity Assessment Body
roles.description: Accredited body that audits and certifies qualified trust service providers

roles.label: Supervisory Body
roles.description: National authority supervising EUDIW providers and/or trust service providers

profiles.label: EUDIW Supervision
profiles.description: Supervisory body for European Digital Identity Wallet providers (Art 46a)

profiles.label: Trust Service Supervision
profiles.description: Supervisory body for qualified/non-qualified trust service providers (Art 46b)

requirements.requirement: Be accredited per EN ISO/IEC 17065:2012 and ETSI EN 319403-1 v2.3.1
requirements.explanation:
CABs must be accredited in accordance with standard EN ISO/IEC 17065:2012
supplemented by standard ETSI EN 319403-1 v2.3.1 for the purposes of
making certification decisions.
requirements.legalText:
For the purposes of making certification decisions in accordance with a
specific conformity assessment scheme, conformity assessment bodies shall
be accredited in accordance with standard EN ISO/IEC 17065:2012 supplemented
by standard ETSI EN 319403-1 v2.3.1.

requirements.requirement: Undergo accreditation by NABs per EN ISO/IEC 17011:2017
requirements.explanation:
CAB accreditation must be performed by a national accreditation body
that complies with standard EN ISO/IEC 17011:2017.
requirements.legalText:
The accreditation of conformity assessment bodies referred to in paragraph 1
shall be performed by a national accreditation body in compliance with
standard EN ISO/IEC 17011:2017.

requirements.requirement: Make certificates of conformity publicly available
requirements.explanation:
CABs must publish all certificates of conformity they issue in a
public repository maintained by that CAB for that purpose.
requirements.legalText:
Conformity assessment bodies shall make the certificates of conformity
they issue available in a public repository maintained by that conformity
assessment body for that purpose.

requirements.requirement: Ensure subcontractors comply with reference standards
requirements.explanation:
When subcontracting conformity assessment activities, CABs must ensure
subcontractors comply with the standards set out in Annex I of 2025/2162
for the specific activity being subcontracted.
requirements.legalText:
Any subcontracting by the conformity assessment body of the performance
of conformity assessment activities shall duly consider the nature of the
activity to be performed. The conformity assessment body shall ensure that
the subcontractor complies with the standards set out in Annex I for the
specific activity being subcontracted.

requirements.requirement: Enable QTSPs to submit complete reports to supervisory bodies
requirements.explanation:
Upon issuing a certification decision, CABs must ensure that the
QTSP can submit the complete conformity assessment reports to
supervisory bodies.
requirements.legalText:
Conformity assessment bodies shall ensure, upon issuing a certification
decision, that the qualified trust services provider to whom the decision
relates, is able to submit the complete conformity assessment reports
corresponding to that decision to the supervisory bodies.

requirements.requirement: Use conformity assessment schemes compliant with ISO/IEC 17067:2013 type 6
requirements.explanation:
CABs must use conformity assessment schemes that comply with scheme
type 6 of standard EN ISO/IEC 17067:2013 and the requirements of
the implementing regulation.
requirements.legalText:
A conformity assessment scheme shall comply with scheme type 6 of
standard EN ISO/IEC 17067:2013 and with the requirements laid down
in this Article.

requirements.requirement: Include reference standards from Annex II in schemes
requirements.explanation:
CABs must use schemes that include at least the standards set out
in Annex II of 2025/2162, identifying the year and version number.
requirements.legalText:
Scheme owners shall ensure that their conformity assessment schemes
include at least the standards, as applicable, set out in Annex II
by indicating the year and version number of these standards.

requirements.requirement: Conduct yearly surveillance assessments for each qualified service
requirements.explanation:
CABs must conduct at least one surveillance conformity assessment
annually for every evaluated qualified trust service.
requirements.legalText:
Scheme owners shall ensure that their conformity assessment schemes
require that at least one surveillance conformity assessment is
conducted annually for every evaluated qualified trust service.

requirements.requirement: Produce conformity assessment reports per Annex III specifications
requirements.explanation:
CABs must produce conformity assessment reports that comply with the
detailed specifications set out in Annex III of 2025/2162.
requirements.legalText:
The conformity assessment report referred to in Article 20(1) of
Regulation (EU) No 910/2014, shall comply with the specifications
set out in Annex III.

requirements.requirement: Include clear certification decision confirming compliance
requirements.explanation:
Reports must be accompanied by a clear certification decision
confirming whether the assessed QTSP and services meet eIDAS and
NIS2 requirements.
requirements.legalText:
The conformity assessment report shall be accompanied by a clear
certification decision in accordance with clause 7.6 of standard
ETSI EN 319403-1 v2.3.1, confirming whether the assessed trust service
provider and the assessed qualified trust services it provides or aims
to provide meet the requirements laid down in Regulation (EU) No 910/2014
and in Article 21 of Directive (EU) 2022/2555.

requirements.requirement: Specify QTSP identity and all subsidiaries/subcontractors
requirements.explanation:
Reports must include the QTSP name, registration number, addresses,
and the same for all subsidiaries, affiliated entities, contractors
and subcontractors operating trust service components.
requirements.legalText:
The report shall specify the name of the qualified trust service
provider and, where applicable, its registration number, its official
postal address, and its electronic address as well as, where applicable,
the same information for all subsidiaries, affiliated legal entities,
contractors and subcontractors that are operating trust service
components in the scope of the provision of the qualified trust services.

requirements.requirement: Include detailed assessment scope description
requirements.explanation:
Reports must include a detailed description of the scope of assessment,
including the specific qualified trust services covered.
requirements.legalText:
The report shall include a detailed description of the scope of the
assessment of the qualified trust service provider, including the
specific qualified trust services covered by the assessment.

requirements.requirement: Contain sufficient evidence demonstrating compliance
requirements.explanation:
Reports must contain sufficient evidence to demonstrate that the
QTSP and services fulfil eIDAS and NIS2 requirements.
requirements.legalText:
The report shall contain sufficient evidence to demonstrate that
the qualified trust service provider and the qualified trust services
it provides fulfil the requirements laid down in Regulation (EU)
No 910/2014 and in Article 21 of Directive (EU) 2022/2555.

requirements.requirement: Specify CAB identity and accreditation details
requirements.explanation:
Reports must specify the CAB name, registration number, addresses,
NAB details, assessor names and roles, accreditation certificate link,
and conformity assessment scheme identification.
requirements.legalText:
The report shall specify the name of the conformity assessment body,
registration number, addresses, the name and country of the national
accreditation body, the names of natural persons involved and their
respective role, the link to the official website containing the
accreditation certificate, and the conformity assessment scheme for
which the body has been accredited.

requirements.requirement: Include qualified electronic signature on reports
requirements.explanation:
Electronic reports must contain at least one qualified electronic
signature identifying the responsible person authorised to adopt
the certification decision.
requirements.legalText:
The report shall contain at least one qualified electronic signature,
where the report is provided in an electronic form, or handwritten
signature, identifying the name and title of the responsible person
or persons that authorised to adopt the certification decision on
behalf of the conformity assessment body.

requirements.requirement: Identify all service digital identities per trust service type
requirements.explanation:
Reports must identify service digital identities per type of qualified
trust service, including URIs for non-PKI services and detailed PKI
certificate information for PKI-based services.
requirements.legalText:
The report shall identify, in accordance with clause 5.5.3 of standard
ETSI TS 119612 v.2.4.1, the service digital identities per type of
qualified trust service, providing URI identifiers for non-PKI services
and Subject Key Identifier, Base64 PEM certificate representation,
inclusion/exclusion criteria, and hierarchy information for PKI services.

requirements.requirement: Provide detailed PKI hierarchy description
requirements.explanation:
For PKI-based services, reports must include a detailed description
of the public key infrastructure functional hierarchy including
root, intermediate, and issuing CAs and certificate policy sets.
requirements.legalText:
The report shall provide, where applicable, a detailed description
of the public key infrastructure functional hierarchy, per type of
qualified trust service, including illustration of hierarchy, Subject
Key Identifiers, and for each issuing CA the list of certificate
policy sets with identification criteria and qualified/non-qualified
and purpose indicators.

requirements.requirement: List all third parties and subcontractors with assessment scope
requirements.explanation:
Reports must include an exhaustive list of third parties and
subcontractors providing trust service components, indicating
whether they were subject to the conformity assessment.
requirements.legalText:
The report shall include an exhaustive list of third parties, including
subcontractors, which provide qualified trust service components or
service components by indicating their name, location of sites, and
an indication whether those third parties and sites have been subject
to the conformity assessment and to which extent.

requirements.requirement: Include exhaustive list of 14 categories of QTSP documentation
requirements.explanation:
Reports must include a comprehensive list of all QTSP internal and
public documents reviewed, including practice statements, policies,
terms, termination plans, risk documentation, security breach plans,
and corporate documents.
requirements.legalText:
The report shall include an exhaustive list of public and qualified
trust service providers' internal documents which have been part of
the conformity assessment, including: practice statements, qualified
trust service policies, terms and conditions, termination plan, risk
documentation, security breach notification plan, supporting internal
documents, memorandum and articles of incorporation, evidence of
financial resources and insurance, list of standards claimed, list
of certified devices, and list of HSMs used.

requirements.requirement: Assess compliance with all applicable implementing acts
requirements.explanation:
Reports must contain an assessment of fulfilment of requirements
from all applicable service-specific implementing acts adopted
under eIDAS for the specific qualified trust service types.
requirements.legalText:
The report shall contain an assessment of the fulfilment of the
requirements that apply to the relevant qualified trust services
pursuant to Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 and the implementing and
delegated acts that apply to that qualified trust service as adopted
in accordance with Articles 24, 28, 33, 34, 38, 42, 44, 45, 29a, 45d,
and 45l of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014.

requirements.requirement: Assess compliance with NIS2 Article 21 requirements
requirements.explanation:
Reports must contain an assessment of fulfilment of cybersecurity
requirements under Article 21 of Directive (EU) 2022/2555 (NIS2).
requirements.legalText:
The report shall contain an assessment of the fulfilment of the
requirements that apply to qualified trust service provider and to
the relevant qualified trust services pursuant to Article 21 of
Directive (EU) 2022/2555, and under the implementing acts adopted
in accordance with Article 21(5) of that Directive.

requirements.requirement: Declare absence of non-conformities or provide remediation plan
requirements.explanation:
Reports must declare absence of any non-conformities, or if any are
identified, include a corrective action plan with timescales and
planned evaluation tasks.
requirements.legalText:
The report shall contain a statement declaring, where applicable, the
absence of any non-conformities, irrespective of their level of
criticality; where any non-conformity is identified, the report shall
provide a plan of corrective actions and their timescale, provided by
the qualified trust service provider and agreed by the conformity
assessment body, together with the description of planned evaluation
tasks to verify correction.

requirements.requirement: Identify opportunities for improvement where appropriate
requirements.explanation:
Reports may contain recommendations for improvement concerning
the QTSP's fulfilment of relevant requirements.
requirements.legalText:
The report shall contain, where appropriate and necessary, an indication
of opportunities for improvement concerning the fulfilment by the
qualified trust service provider and the qualified trust services it
provides of relevant requirements.

requirements.requirement: Document assessment period and person-days for each stage
requirements.explanation:
Reports must identify the period and time taken (in person-days)
for each stage of the conformity assessment including documentation
audit, implementation assessment, and onsite inspections.
requirements.legalText:
The report shall identify, for each stage of the conformity assessment,
including documentation audit, implementation assessment and onsite
inspections, the period in relation to which the assessment has been
conducted and the time taken by the conformity assessment body in
person-days to conduct the assessment.

requirements.requirement: Include test results and production samples assessment
requirements.explanation:
Reports must include the scope, description, and results of a
significant set of tests or production samples for all relevant
types of outputs from the assessed qualified trust services.
requirements.legalText:
The report shall include the scope, the description, and the results
of a significant set of tests or production samples and their assessment
for all relevant and applicable types of outputs from the assessed
qualified trust services.

requirements.requirement: Specify surveillance and next assessment deadlines
requirements.explanation:
Reports must indicate the deadline for the next surveillance
conformity assessment and the next full conformity assessment
per Article 20(1).
requirements.legalText:
The report shall indicate the following deadlines: (a) the deadline
within which the next surveillance conformity assessment must be
conducted; (b) the deadline within which the next conformity assessment
must be conducted in accordance with Article 20(1) of Regulation
(EU) No 910/2014.

requirements.requirement: Include declaration that reports are for supervisory body use
requirements.explanation:
Reports must contain an explicit declaration that the certification
documents are also intended for use by the competent national
supervisory body.
requirements.legalText:
The report shall contain an explicit declaration stating that the
certification documents, including the conformity assessment report,
are also intended for the use by the competent national supervisory body.

requirements.requirement: Inform QTSPs of impacts from accreditation reconsideration
requirements.explanation:
When a CAB receives a request from the NAB to take measures due to
scheme changes, it must inform its assessed QTSPs of any impacts
the reconsideration may have, including on future certification
decisions.
requirements.legalText:
Where a conformity assessment body receives a request pursuant to
paragraph 4, it shall, in a timely manner, inform any qualified
trust service providers that it has previously assessed under the
relevant conformity assessment scheme of any impacts that the
reconsideration of the conformity assessment body's accreditation
may have on those qualified trust service providers, including with
respect to future certification decisions made under that scheme.

requirements.requirement: Use EN ISO/IEC 17025:2017 for subcontracted testing
requirements.explanation:
When subcontracting testing activities, CABs must ensure the
subcontractor complies with EN ISO/IEC 17025:2017.
requirements.legalText:
Reference standards for the subcontracting of conformity assessment
activities: EN ISO/IEC 17025:2017 for testing activities.

requirements.requirement: Use EN ISO/IEC 17021-1:2015 for subcontracted management system audits
requirements.explanation:
When subcontracting audit activities of management systems, CABs
must ensure the subcontractor complies with EN ISO/IEC 17021-1:2015.
requirements.legalText:
Reference standards for the subcontracting of conformity assessment
activities: EN ISO/IEC 17021-1:2015 for audit activities of
management systems.

requirements.requirement: Use EN ISO/IEC 17020:2012 for subcontracted inspections
requirements.explanation:
When subcontracting inspection activities, CABs must ensure the
subcontractor complies with EN ISO/IEC 17020:2012.
requirements.legalText:
Reference standards for the subcontracting of conformity assessment
activities: EN ISO/IEC 17020:2012 for inspection activities.

requirements.requirement: Use EN ISO/IEC 17065:2012 for subcontracted conformity assessments
requirements.explanation:
When subcontracting conformity assessment activities, CABs must
ensure the subcontractor complies with EN ISO/IEC 17065:2012.
requirements.legalText:
Reference standards for the subcontracting of conformity assessment
activities: EN ISO/IEC 17065:2012 for conformity assessments activities.

requirements.requirement: Member States must notify CAB names, addresses, and accreditation details
requirements.explanation:
This is a Member State obligation that affects CABs: their details
must be notified to the Commission and made available to all
Member States.
requirements.legalText:
Member States shall, without undue delay, notify to the Commission
the names, addresses and accreditation details of the conformity
assessment bodies referred to in paragraph 1 and any subsequent
changes thereto. The Commission shall make that information
available to all Member States.

requirements.requirement: Audit QTSPs at least every 24 months at QTSP expense
requirements.explanation:
CABs perform audits of qualified trust service providers at least
every 24 months. The audit confirms that QTSPs and their services
meet eIDAS and NIS2 requirements.
requirements.legalText:
Qualified trust service providers shall be audited at their own
expense at least every 24 months by a conformity assessment body.
The audit shall confirm that the qualified trust service providers
and the qualified trust services provided by them fulfil the
requirements laid down in this Regulation and in Article 21 of
Directive (EU) 2022/2555.

requirements.requirement: Issue conformity assessment report for QTSP initiation
requirements.explanation:
CABs issue the conformity assessment report that trust service
providers must submit to supervisory bodies when they intend to
start providing a qualified trust service.
requirements.legalText:
Where trust service providers intend to start providing a qualified
trust service, they shall notify the supervisory body of their
intention together with a conformity assessment report issued by a
conformity assessment body confirming the fulfilment of the
requirements laid down in this Regulation and in Article 21 of
Directive (EU) 2022/2555.

requirements.requirement: Existing ETSI EN 319403 v2.2.2 accreditation valid until May 2027
requirements.explanation:
CABs accredited before 17 November 2025 under ETSI EN 319403 v2.2.2
or earlier have their accreditation considered to meet the new
requirements until 17 May 2027.
requirements.legalText:
Conformity assessment bodies that have, before 17 November 2025,
been accredited with reference to standard ETSI EN 319403 version 2.2.2,
or earlier version, for the purposes of the assessment of conformity
with Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 of qualified trust service providers
and the qualified trust services they provide shall have their
accreditation be considered to meet the requirements of Article 2(1)
until 17 May 2027.

requirements.requirement: Meet Annex V content requirements
requirements.explanation:
Qualified electronic attestations of attributes must contain all elements
specified in Annex V of the regulation. This includes automated processing
indicators, unique issuer identification, attestation identity codes,
qualified signatures/seals, certificate locations, and validity status info.
requirements.legalText:
Qualified electronic attestation of attributes shall meet the requirements
laid down in Annex V.

requirements.requirement: Revoked QEAA loses validity immediately and irreversibly
requirements.explanation:
Once a qualified electronic attestation of attributes is revoked after
initial issuance, it immediately loses its legal validity. The revocation
cannot be undone or reversed under any circumstances.
requirements.legalText:
Where a qualified electronic attestation of attributes has been revoked
after initial issuance, it shall lose its validity from the moment of
its revocation and its status shall not in any circumstances be reverted.

requirements.requirement: Meet Annex VII content requirements
requirements.explanation:
Electronic attestations of attributes issued by or on behalf of a public
sector body responsible for an authentic source must contain all elements
specified in Annex VII, including indication of authentic source origin,
unique public body identification, subject identification, attested
attributes, validity period, unique identity code, qualified signature/seal,
certificate location, and validity status services.
requirements.legalText:
An electronic attestation of attributes issued by or on behalf of a public
sector body responsible for an authentic source shall meet the following
requirements: (a) those set out in Annex VII.

requirements.requirement: Use qualified certificate with authentic source indication
requirements.explanation:
The qualified certificate supporting the electronic signature or seal must
contain specific certified attributes indicating the issuing body is established
under Union or national law as responsible for the authentic source, provide
data representing the authentic source, and identify the relevant law.
requirements.legalText:
The qualified certificate supporting the qualified electronic signature or
qualified electronic seal of the public sector body... containing a specific
set of certified attributes in a form suitable for automated processing and:
(i) indicating that the issuing body is established in accordance with Union
or national law as the responsible for the authentic source...
(ii) providing a set of data unambiguously representing the authentic source...
(iii) identifying the Union or national law referred to in point (i).

requirements.requirement: Meet QTSP-equivalent reliability and trustworthiness
requirements.explanation:
Public sector bodies issuing electronic attestations of attributes must
meet a level of reliability and trustworthiness equivalent to qualified
trust service providers as defined in Article 24 of the regulation.
requirements.legalText:
The Member State where public sector bodies... are established shall ensure
that the public sector bodies that issue electronic attestations of attributes
meet a level of reliability and trustworthiness equivalent to qualified trust
service providers in accordance with Article 24.

requirements.requirement: Be notified by Member State with conformity assessment
requirements.explanation:
Public sector bodies must be notified to the Commission by their Member State,
including a conformity assessment report from a conformity assessment body
confirming compliance with Article 45f requirements.
requirements.legalText:
Member States shall notify public sector bodies... to the Commission. That
notification shall include a conformity assessment report issued by a
conformity assessment body confirming that the requirements set out in
paragraphs 1, 2 and 6 of this Article are met.

requirements.requirement: Revoked attestation loses validity immediately and irreversibly
requirements.explanation:
When an electronic attestation of attributes issued by a public sector body
is revoked, it immediately loses its validity and the revocation cannot be
reversed.
requirements.legalText:
Where an electronic attestation of attributes issued by or on behalf of a
public sector body responsible for an authentic source has been revoked
after initial issuance, it shall lose its validity from the moment of its
revocation and its status shall not be reverted.

requirements.requirement: Provide interface with European Digital Identity Wallets
requirements.explanation:
Public sector bodies issuing electronic attestations of attributes must
provide an interface that allows integration with European Digital Identity
Wallets provided in accordance with Article 5a.
requirements.legalText:
Public sector bodies... issuing electronic attestation of attributes shall
provide an interface with European Digital Identity Wallets that are provided
in accordance with Article 5a.

requirements.requirement: Allow users to request, obtain, store and manage EAA from any MS wallet
requirements.explanation:
All providers of electronic attestations of attributes must enable wallet
users to request, obtain, store, and manage their attestations regardless
of which Member State provided the European Digital Identity Wallet. This
ensures cross-border interoperability for all EAA issuers.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of electronic attestations of attributes shall provide European
Digital Identity Wallet users with the possibility to request, obtain, store
and manage the electronic attestation of attributes irrespective of the
Member State where the European Digital Identity Wallet is provided.

requirements.requirement: Provide interface with EUDI Wallets (QEAA)
requirements.explanation:
Providers of qualified electronic attestations of attributes must provide
an interface that enables integration with European Digital Identity Wallets.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of qualified electronic attestations of attributes shall provide
an interface with European Digital Identity Wallets that are provided in
accordance in Article 5a.

requirements.requirement: Not combine EAA personal data with other services
requirements.explanation:
Personal data collected during the provision of electronic attestation of
attributes services must not be combined with personal data from any other
services offered by the provider or their commercial partners. This applies
to both qualified and non-qualified EAA providers.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of qualified and non-qualified electronic attestation of attributes
services shall not combine personal data relating to the provision of those
services with personal data from any other services offered by them or their
commercial partners.

requirements.requirement: Keep EAA personal data logically separate
requirements.explanation:
Personal data relating to the provision of electronic attestation of attributes
services must be kept logically separate from other data held by the provider.
This ensures data isolation and limits data processing scope.
requirements.legalText:
Personal data relating to the provision of electronic attestation of attributes
services shall be kept logically separate from other data held by the provider
of electronic attestation of attributes.

requirements.requirement: Implement QEAA services functionally separate from other services
requirements.explanation:
Providers of qualified electronic attestation of attributes services must
implement these services in a manner that is functionally separate from
other services they provide. This ensures operational isolation of the
trust service.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of qualified electronic attestation of attributes' services shall
implement the provision of such qualified trust services in a manner that
is functionally separate from other services provided by them.

requirements.requirement: Issue EAA in compliant format per Annex I of 2024/2979
requirements.explanation:
Electronic attestations of attributes issued to wallet units must comply
with at least one of the standards listed in Annex I of Implementing
Regulation 2024/2979 (Integrity and Core Functions). This ensures
interoperability across the wallet ecosystem.
requirements.legalText:
Electronic attestations of attributes issued to wallet units shall comply
with at least one of the standards in the list set out in Annex I of
Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Identify to wallet using wallet-relying party access certificate
requirements.explanation:
When issuing electronic attestations of attributes to wallet units, the
provider must identify itself to the wallet unit using its wallet-relying
party access certificate. This ensures the wallet can verify the issuer's
authenticity.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of electronic attestations of attributes shall identify themselves
to wallet units using their wallet-relying party access certificate.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Include authentication and validation information in EAA
requirements.explanation:
Electronic attestations of attributes issued to wallet units must contain
the information necessary for authentication and validation of those
attestations, enabling relying parties to verify their authenticity and
validity.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of electronic attestations of attributes shall ensure that
electronic attestations of attributes issued to wallet units contain the
information necessary for authentication and validation of those electronic
attestations of attributes.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Comply with ETSI EN 319 401 standard
requirements.explanation:
Providers of qualified electronic attestations of attributes and public
sector body attestation providers must issue their attestations according
to the specifications for trust service providers established in standard
ETSI EN 319 401 v3.1.1 (2024-06).
requirements.legalText:
Providers of qualified electronic attestations of attributes and providers
of electronic attestation of attributes issued by or on behalf of a public
sector body responsible for an authentic source shall issue their attestations
to natural or legal persons according to the specifications for trust service
providers established in standard ETSI EN 319 401 v3.1.1 (2024-06).

requirements.requirement: Issue attestations in compliant format per Annex II of 2024/2979
requirements.explanation:
Attestations must be issued in a format according to one of the standards
listed in Annex II of Implementing Regulation 2024/2979, ensuring technical
interoperability across the wallet ecosystem.
requirements.legalText:
Providers... shall issue their attestations in a format according to one
of the standards listed in Annex II of Commission Implementing Regulation
(EU) 2024/2979.

requirements.requirement: Verify requester has right to act on behalf of subject
requirements.explanation:
When applicable, attestation providers must verify that the requester of
the attestation has the right to act on behalf of the person that is the
subject of the attestation before issuance.
requirements.legalText:
For the issuance of attestations to natural or legal persons, providers...
shall: (a) where applicable, verify that the requester of the attestation
has the right to act on behalf of the person that is the subject of the
attestation.

requirements.requirement: Verify identity of authentic source used
requirements.explanation:
When applicable, attestation providers must verify the identity of the
authentic source used as a source for the attributes included in the
attestation.
requirements.legalText:
For the issuance of attestations to natural or legal persons, providers...
shall: (b) where applicable, verify the identity of the authentic source
used as a source for the attributes included in the attestation.

requirements.requirement: Process only minimum necessary attributes
requirements.explanation:
Attestation providers must process only the minimum set of attributes
necessary for the issuance and management of the attestation, applying
data minimization principles.
requirements.legalText:
For the issuance of attestations to natural or legal persons, providers...
shall: (c) process only the minimum set of attributes necessary for the
issuance and management of the attestation.

requirements.requirement: Authenticate to wallet unit before issuance
requirements.explanation:
When issuing attestations to a European Digital Identity Wallet, the
attestation provider must authenticate to the wallet unit, establishing
a verified identity before transferring the attestation.
requirements.legalText:
In addition, where the attestation is issued to a European Digital Identity
Wallet, the attestation provider shall: (a) authenticate to the wallet unit.

requirements.requirement: Verify wallet unit is not revoked or suspended
requirements.explanation:
Before issuing an attestation to a wallet, the provider must verify that
the wallet unit has not been revoked or suspended, ensuring attestations
are only issued to valid wallet units.
requirements.legalText:
In addition, where the attestation is issued to a European Digital Identity
Wallet, the attestation provider shall: (b) verify that the wallet unit is
not revoked or suspended.

requirements.requirement: Comply with attestation scheme requirements if applicable
requirements.explanation:
When issuing attestations that are included in schemes registered in the
catalogue of schemes for attestation of attributes, providers must comply
with the requirements of the corresponding scheme. Compliance with scheme
requirements must be part of conformity assessment.
requirements.legalText:
Where providers... issue electronic attestations of attributes which are
included in schemes registered in the catalogue of schemes for the
attestation of attributes, they shall comply with the requirements of the
corresponding scheme for the attestation of attributes. Policies and
procedures established by the issuers... shall be part of the conformity
assessment established in Regulation (EU) No 910/2014.

requirements.requirement: Maintain public revocation/validity status policies
requirements.explanation:
Attestation providers must have written and publicly accessible policies
relating to validity or revocation status management, including conditions
for revocation without delay and measures for ensuring validity status
information availability.
requirements.legalText:
Providers... shall have written and publicly accessible policies relating
to validity or revocation status management. These policies shall include,
where applicable, the conditions under which electronic attestations of
attributes can be revoked without delay and measures for ensuring the
availability of the validity status information.

requirements.requirement: Only issuer can revoke its own attestations
requirements.explanation:
Only the provider that issued an electronic attestation of attributes
has the authority to revoke it. No other party can revoke an attestation.
requirements.legalText:
Providers... shall be the only entities able to revoke the electronic
attestations of attributes they issue.

requirements.requirement: Revoke on user request
requirements.explanation:
For attestations with validity periods over 24 hours, providers must revoke
upon explicit request from the person to whom the attestation was issued
or, where applicable, the subject of the attestation.
requirements.legalText:
Providers... whenever those attestations are issued with a validity period
of more than 24 hours, shall revoke them in at least the following
circumstances: (a) upon the explicit request of the person to whom the
electronic attestation of attributes was issued or, where applicable, of
the subject of the attestation.

requirements.requirement: Revoke on security or trustworthiness compromise
requirements.explanation:
Providers must revoke attestations when they become aware of any compromise
to the security or trustworthiness of the attestations, protecting relying
parties from untrustworthy information.
requirements.legalText:
Providers... shall revoke them in at least the following circumstances:
(b) where it is known to the provider that there has been a compromise
of the security or trustworthiness of the qualified electronic attestations
of attributes or electronic attestations of attributes issued by or on
behalf of a public sector body responsible for an authentic source.

requirements.requirement: Use privacy-preserving revocation techniques
requirements.explanation:
Providers must set up revocation techniques and management methods that
are privacy preserving and hinder linkability or traceability, protecting
user privacy even during revocation processes.
requirements.legalText:
Providers... shall set up revocation techniques and management methods
that are privacy preserving and hindering linkability or traceability.

requirements.requirement: Provide validity status information to relying parties
requirements.explanation:
Providers must make validity or revocation status information available
to relying parties in a manner that ensures the integrity and authenticity
of that information.
requirements.legalText:
Providers... shall make available to relying parties information on the
validity or revocation status of the electronic attestations of attributes
they have issued in a manner that ensures the integrity and authenticity
of that information.

requirements.requirement: Notify supervisory body of significant changes
requirements.explanation:
Qualified EAA issuers must notify the supervisory body at least one month
before implementing significant changes to service descriptions, technical
architecture, hosting, cryptographic techniques, registration procedures,
organizational structure, termination plans, financial resources, trusted
list entries, or third-party arrangements.
requirements.legalText:
In notifications referred to in Article 24(2), point (a), of Regulation
(EU) No 910/2014, qualified trust service providers shall cover at least
significant changes to all of the following elements: (a) the service
descriptions, policies, practice statements or associated terms and
conditions; (b) the technical architecture... [etc.]

requirements.requirement: Implement risk management framework
requirements.explanation:
Qualified EAA issuers must implement a risk management framework in
accordance with Implementing Regulation 2025/2160, which addresses legal,
business, operational and other direct or indirect risks to the provision
of the qualified trust service.
requirements.legalText:
The requirements laid down in Article 2, Article 3 and Article 4 of
Commission Implementing Regulation 2025/2160 shall apply.

requirements.requirement: Establish and maintain termination plan
requirements.explanation:
Qualified EAA issuers must establish a termination plan for each qualified
trust service, ensuring continuity of service and evidence provision in
legal proceedings. The plan must cover anticipated and unanticipated
termination scenarios, be reviewed at least every two years, and be
backed by sufficient financial resources or insurance.
requirements.legalText:
Qualified trust service providers shall establish a termination plan for
each qualified trust service they provide, that establishes the necessary
provisions for the effective and correct application of the termination
of the service or parts thereof, for the purposes of ensuring continuity
of the service and of providing evidence in legal proceedings...

requirements.requirement: Publish revocation status within 24 hours
requirements.explanation:
When a qualified trust service provider issuing qualified attestations
decides to revoke an attestation, it must register the revocation in its
database and publish the revocation status within 24 hours of receipt of
the revocation request. The revocation becomes effective immediately upon
publication. This is explicitly extended to QEAA by Art. 24(4a).
requirements.legalText:
If a qualified trust service provider issuing qualified certificates
decides to revoke a certificate, it shall register such revocation in its
certificate database and publish the revocation status of the certificate
in a timely manner, and in any event within 24 hours after the receipt of
the request. The revocation shall become effective immediately upon its
publication... Paragraphs 3 and 4 shall apply accordingly to the revocation
of qualified electronic attestations of attributes.

requirements.requirement: Provide free revocation status checking for relying parties
requirements.explanation:
Qualified EAA providers must provide relying parties with the ability to
check the validity or revocation status of attestations. This must be
available on a per-attestation basis, at any time, beyond the validity
period, in an automated manner that is reliable, free of charge, and
efficient. This is explicitly extended to QEAA by Art. 24(4a).
requirements.legalText:
Qualified trust service providers issuing qualified certificates shall
provide to any relying party information on the validity or revocation
status of qualified certificates issued by them. This information shall
be made available at least on a per certificate basis at any time and
beyond the validity period of the certificate in an automated manner that
is reliable, free of charge and efficient... Paragraphs 3 and 4 shall
apply accordingly to the revocation of qualified electronic attestations
of attributes.

requirements.requirement: Notify supervisory body before starting qualified trust service
requirements.explanation:
Before starting to provide a qualified trust service (including QEAA),
the provider must notify the supervisory body of the Member State where
established with its intention to start the service, along with a
conformity assessment report.
requirements.legalText:
When trust service providers intend to start the provision of a qualified
trust service, they shall notify the supervisory body of the Member State
in which they are established... with their intention to start the provision
of a qualified trust service. They shall also provide the supervisory body
with a conformity assessment report...

requirements.requirement: Maintain personnel with necessary expertise and reliability
requirements.explanation:
Qualified EAA issuers must employ personnel possessing the necessary
expertise, reliability, experience, and qualifications to perform the
services. Staff must have competence in applicable laws, security, and
technical knowledge appropriate to the trust service.
requirements.legalText:
[QTSPs shall] employ personnel and, if applicable, subcontractors possessing
the necessary expertise, reliability, experience and qualifications and having
received appropriate training regarding security and personal data protection
rules and who apply administrative and management procedures that correspond
to European or international standards.

requirements.requirement: Maintain sufficient financial resources or liability coverage
requirements.explanation:
Qualified EAA issuers must maintain sufficient financial resources or
obtain appropriate liability insurance to cover their liabilities arising
from the provision of trust services, in accordance with national law on
liability.
requirements.legalText:
[QTSPs shall] with regard to point (c), maintain sufficient financial
resources or obtain appropriate liability insurance, according to national
law on liability, to cover liabilities arising from the provision of
qualified trust services.

requirements.requirement: Verify identity of persons or entities to whom attestations are issued
requirements.explanation:
Before issuing a qualified electronic attestation of attributes, the
provider must verify the identity of the natural or legal person to whom
the attestation is issued, using appropriate identity verification methods.
requirements.legalText:
When issuing a qualified certificate or a qualified electronic attestation
of attributes for the purpose of a trust service, a qualified trust service
provider shall verify, by appropriate means and in accordance with national
law, the identity and, if applicable, any specific attributes of the natural
or legal person to whom the qualified certificate or the qualified electronic
attestation of attributes is issued...

requirements.requirement: Take appropriate measures against security threats
requirements.explanation:
Qualified EAA issuers must take appropriate measures against forgery,
theft, or misappropriation of data, and against unauthorized deletion,
alteration, or rendering of data inaccessible.
requirements.legalText:
[QTSPs shall] take appropriate measures against forgery, theft or
misappropriation of data or, without right, deleting, altering or
rendering data inaccessible.

requirements.requirement: Record and retain relevant information for evidence purposes
requirements.explanation:
Qualified EAA issuers must record and keep accessible all relevant
information concerning data issued and received, for the purpose of
providing evidence in legal proceedings and ensuring continuity of
service after the provider ceases activities.
requirements.legalText:
[QTSPs shall] record and keep accessible for as long as necessary after
the activities of the qualified trust service provider have ceased, all
relevant information concerning data issued and received by the qualified
trust service provider, for the purpose of providing evidence in legal
proceedings and for the purpose of ensuring continuity of the service.
Such recording may be done electronically.

requirements.requirement: Ensure lawful processing of personal data
requirements.explanation:
Qualified EAA issuers must ensure lawful processing of personal data
in accordance with GDPR requirements.
requirements.legalText:
[QTSPs shall] ensure lawful processing of personal data in accordance
with Directive 95/46/EC. [Note: Now GDPR (EU) 2016/679]

requirements.requirement: Issue PID according to eID scheme
requirements.explanation:
PID Providers must issue person identification data to wallet units
in accordance with the electronic identification schemes under which
wallet solutions are provided.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of person identification data shall issue person identification
data to wallet units in accordance with the electronic identification
schemes under which wallet solutions are provided.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Include authentication and validation information
requirements.explanation:
Each PID issued must contain all information necessary for relying parties
to authenticate and validate the person identification data.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of person identification data shall ensure that person
identification data issued to wallet units contains the information
necessary for authentication and validation of the person identification data.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Comply with Annex technical specifications
requirements.explanation:
All PID issued must comply with the technical specifications set out
in the Annex to 2024/2977, including mandatory and optional attributes,
metadata, and encoding formats.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of person identification data shall ensure that person
identification data issued to wallet units comply with the technical
specifications set out in the Annex.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Ensure PID uniqueness within Member State
requirements.explanation:
The PID issued to any given wallet user must be unique within that
Member State. This prevents identity collision and supports reliable
cross-border identification.
requirements.legalText:
Member States shall ensure that the person identification data issued
to a given wallet user is unique for the Member State.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Cryptographically bind PID to wallet unit
requirements.explanation:
The PID must be cryptographically bound to the specific wallet unit
to which it is issued. This prevents copying or transfer of credentials
to unauthorized devices.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of person identification data shall ensure that person
identification data that they issue is cryptographically bound to the
wallet unit to which it is issued.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Publish list of supported wallet solutions
requirements.explanation:
Member States must make publicly available a list of wallet solutions
that are supported by their PID providers as part of electronic
identification schemes.
requirements.legalText:
Member States shall make publicly available a list of wallet solutions
that are supported by providers of person identification data that is
part of electronic identification schemes of that Member State.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Enroll users at assurance level high
requirements.explanation:
Wallet users must be enrolled in accordance with assurance level high
requirements from 2015/1502. PID Providers must perform identity
verification of the wallet user before issuing PID.
requirements.legalText:
Member States shall enroll wallet users in accordance with the requirements
relating to enrolment at assurance level high, as set out in Commission
Implementing Regulation (EU) 2015/1502. In the context of the enrolment
process, providers of person identification data shall perform identity
verification of the wallet user in accordance with the requirements related
to identity proofing and verification before issuing the person identification
data to the wallet unit of the corresponding wallet user.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Identify self to wallet unit during issuance
requirements.explanation:
When issuing PID, the provider must authenticate itself to the wallet
unit using wallet-relying party access certificates or another mechanism
compliant with assurance level high.
requirements.legalText:
When issuing person identification data to wallet units, providers of
person identification data shall identify themselves to wallet units
using their wallet-relying party access certificate or by using another
authentication mechanism in accordance with an electronic identity scheme
notified at assurance level high.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Validate wallet unit before issuance
requirements.explanation:
Before issuing PID, providers must authenticate and validate the wallet
unit attestation and verify the wallet unit belongs to an accepted solution.
requirements.legalText:
Before issuing person identification data to a wallet unit, providers
of person identification data shall authenticate and validate the wallet
unit attestation of the wallet unit and verify that the wallet unit
belongs to a wallet solution the provider of person identification data
accepts or use another authentication mechanism in accordance with an
electronic identity scheme notified at assurance level high.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Maintain public revocation policies
requirements.explanation:
PID Providers must maintain written, publicly accessible policies
relating to validity status management, including conditions for
immediate revocation.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of person identification data issued to a wallet unit shall
have written and publicly accessible policies relating to validity
status management, including, where applicable, the conditions under
which such person identification data can be revoked without delay.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Exclusive revocation authority
requirements.explanation:
Only the provider that issued PID can revoke it. No other entity
may revoke person identification data.
requirements.legalText:
Only providers of person identification data or electronic attestation
of attributes can revoke the person identification data or electronic
attestations of attributes issued by them.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Notify user within 24 hours of revocation
requirements.explanation:
When PID is revoked, the provider must inform the wallet user within
24 hours through secure channels, stating the reasons clearly.
requirements.legalText:
Where providers of person identification data have revoked person
identification data, they shall, through dedicated and secure channels,
inform wallet users subject of those person identification data within
24 hours of the revocation and of the reasons for the revocation. This
shall be done in a manner that is concise, easily accessible and using
clear and plain language.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Revoke upon user request
requirements.explanation: PID must be revoked upon the explicit request of the wallet user.
requirements.legalText:
Where providers of person identification data revoke person identification
data issued to wallet units, they shall do so in each of the following
circumstances: (a) upon the explicit request of the wallet user to whose
wallet unit the person identification data or electronic attestation of
attributes were issued to.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Revoke when wallet attestation revoked
requirements.explanation: PID must be revoked when the underlying wallet unit attestation is revoked.
requirements.legalText:
Where providers of person identification data revoke person identification
data issued to wallet units, they shall do so in each of the following
circumstances: (b) where the wallet unit attestation to which the person
identification data was issued to has been revoked.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Revoke per policy conditions
requirements.explanation: PID must be revoked in situations determined by the provider's own policies.
requirements.legalText:
Where providers of person identification data revoke person identification
data issued to wallet units, they shall do so in each of the following
circumstances: (c) in other situations determined by the providers of
person identification data or electronic attestations of attributes in
their policies referred to in paragraph 1.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Ensure revocations are irreversible
requirements.explanation: Once PID is revoked, the revocation cannot be reversed.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of person identification data issued to a wallet unit shall
ensure that revocations cannot be reverted.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Retain revoked PID as required by law
requirements.explanation:
Revoked PID must remain accessible for as long as required by
applicable EU or national law.
requirements.legalText:
The revoked person identification data shall remain accessible for as
long as required by Union law or national law.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Publish validity status in privacy-preserving manner
requirements.explanation:
When PID is revoked, providers must make validity status publicly
available in a privacy-preserving manner and indicate its location
in the PID itself.
requirements.legalText:
Where providers of person identification data revoke person identification
data issued to wallet units, they shall make publicly available the
validity status of person identification data they issue, in a privacy
preserving manner, and indicate the location of that information in
the person identification data.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Enable privacy-preserving unlinkability
requirements.explanation:
PID Providers must enable privacy preserving techniques that ensure
unlinkability where attestations do not require user identification.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of person identification data shall enable privacy preserving
techniques which ensure unlinkability where the electronic attestations
of attributes do not require the identification of the user.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Include mandatory natural person attributes
requirements.explanation:
PID for natural persons must include mandatory attributes: family_name,
given_name, birth_date, birth_place, and nationality.
requirements.legalText:
Set of natural person identification data - mandatory attributes:
family_name (Current last name(s) or surname(s)), given_name (Current
first name(s), including middle name(s)), birth_date (Day, month, and
year of birth), birth_place (country, state, or municipality of birth),
nationality (alpha-2 country code representing nationality).

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Include mandatory metadata
requirements.explanation:
All PID must include mandatory metadata: expiry_date, issuing_authority,
and issuing_country.
requirements.legalText:
Set of metadata about person identification data - mandatory:
expiry_date (Date and if possible time when PID will expire),
issuing_authority (Name of the administrative authority that issued
the PID, or ISO 3166 alpha-2 country code),
issuing_country (Alpha-2 country code of the provider).

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Issue PID in required formats
requirements.explanation:
PID must be issued in both required formats: ISO/IEC 18013-5:2021
(mDL format) and W3C Verifiable Credentials Data Model 1.1.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Include mandatory legal person attributes
requirements.explanation:
PID for legal persons must include mandatory attributes: current legal
name and a unique identifier constructed for cross-border identification.
requirements.legalText:
Set of legal person identification data - mandatory:
current legal name (mandatory),
a unique identifier constructed by the sending Member State in accordance
with the technical specifications for the purposes of cross-border
identification and which is as persistent as possible in time (mandatory).

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Handle unknown attribute values appropriately
requirements.explanation:
Where an attribute value is not known or cannot be issued, Member States
must use an attribute value appropriate to the situation instead.
requirements.legalText:
Where an attribute value is not known for the person or cannot otherwise
be issued as part of the person identification dataset, Member States
shall use an attribute value appropriate to the situation instead.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977
legalSourceInfo.description: Rules for person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes

requirements.requirement: Associate PID with wallet ensuring unique representation
requirements.explanation:
PID Providers must ensure that the person identification data uniquely
represents the natural person, legal person, or representative, and is
associated with the European Digital Identity Wallet.
requirements.legalText:
European Digital Identity Wallets shall, in particular: (f) ensure that
the person identification data, which is available from the electronic
identification scheme under which the European Digital Identity Wallet
is provided, uniquely represents the natural person, legal person or the
natural person representing the natural or legal person, and is associated
with that European Digital Identity Wallet.

requirements.requirement: Notify Commission of PID association bodies
requirements.explanation:
Member States must notify the Commission of the bodies responsible for
ensuring that PID is associated with the wallet.
requirements.legalText:
Member States shall, without undue delay, notify the Commission of
information about: (c) the bodies responsible for ensuring that the
person identification data is associated with the European Digital
Identity Wallet in accordance with Article 5a(5), point (f).

requirements.requirement: Notify Commission of PID validation mechanism
requirements.explanation:
Member States must notify the Commission of the mechanism allowing
validation of person identification data.
requirements.legalText:
Member States shall, without undue delay, notify the Commission of
information about: (d) the mechanism allowing for the validation of
the person identification data referred to in Article 5a(5), point (f),
and of the identity of the relying parties.

requirements.requirement: Comply with GDPR for personal data processing
requirements.explanation:
All personal data processing by PID Providers must comply with GDPR
and demonstrate such compliance.
requirements.legalText:
Any processing of personal data carried out by the Member States or
on their behalf by bodies or parties responsible for the provision of
European Digital Identity Wallets as electronic identification means
shall be carried out in accordance with appropriate and effective data
protection measures. Compliance of such processing with Regulation (EU)
2016/679 shall be demonstrated.

requirements.requirement: Accept liability per Article 11 (mutatis mutandis)
requirements.explanation:
PID Providers, through Article 5a(19), are subject to the liability
provisions of Article 11, which assigns liability for failures in
cross-border transactions.
requirements.legalText:
Without prejudice to paragraph 22 of this Article, Article 11 shall
apply mutatis mutandis to the European Digital Identity Wallet.

requirements.requirement: Make services accessible for persons with disabilities
requirements.explanation:
PID issuance must be accessible to persons with disabilities on an
equal basis with other users, per Directive 2019/882.
requirements.legalText:
European Digital Identity Wallets shall be made accessible for use,
by persons with disabilities, on an equal basis with other users, in
accordance with Directive (EU) 2019/882 of the European Parliament and
of the Council.

requirements.requirement: Register with competent supervisory authority before accepting EUDI Wallet
requirements.explanation:
Relying parties intending to rely on European Digital Identity Wallets must register with 
the competent authority in the Member State where they are established. Registration is 
a prerequisite for accepting wallet-based authentication.
requirements.legalText:
Where a relying party intends to rely upon European Digital Identity Wallets for the 
provision of public or private services by means of digital interaction, the relying 
party shall register in the Member State where it is established.

requirements.requirement: Provide registration information including identity and intended data requests
requirements.explanation:
During registration, relying parties must provide specific information including their 
identity, contact details, and importantly - the data they intend to request from users.
This enables oversight of data minimization compliance.
requirements.legalText:
The registration process shall be cost-effective and proportionate-to-risk. The relying 
party shall provide at least: (a) the information necessary to authenticate to European 
Digital Identity Wallets, which as a minimum includes: (i) the Member State in which the 
relying party is established; and (ii) the name of the relying party and, where applicable, 
its registration number as stated in an official record together with identification data 
of that official record; (b) the contact details of the relying party; (c) the intended 
use of European Digital Identity Wallets, including an indication of the data to be 
requested by the relying party from users.

requirements.requirement: Request only data indicated during registration
requirements.explanation:
Relying parties are strictly limited to requesting only the data they declared during 
registration. Requesting additional data beyond the registered scope is prohibited.
requirements.legalText:
Relying parties shall not request users to provide any data other than that indicated 
pursuant to paragraph 2, point (c).

requirements.requirement: Notify changes to registration information without delay
requirements.explanation:
If the relying party's registration information changes (e.g., new data fields requested, 
contact details updated), they must promptly notify the Member State.
requirements.legalText:
Relying parties registered in accordance with this Article shall inform Member States 
without delay about any changes to the information provided in the registration 
pursuant to paragraph 2.

requirements.requirement: Identify yourself to wallet users when requesting data
requirements.explanation:
When relying parties request data from wallet users, they must clearly identify 
themselves. The wallet displays the RP's identity information from their access 
certificate to enable user trust decisions.
requirements.legalText:
Where relying parties intend to rely upon European Digital Identity Wallets, they 
shall identify themselves to the user.

requirements.requirement: Accept pseudonymous authentication where legal identity is not required
requirements.explanation:
When a user's legal identity is not required by law, relying parties must accept 
pseudonymous authentication. Users cannot be forced to reveal their real identity 
when pseudonymous access is sufficient.
requirements.legalText:
Relying parties shall be responsible for carrying out the procedure for authenticating 
and validating person identification data and electronic attestation of attributes 
requested from European Digital Identity Wallets. Relying parties shall not refuse the 
use of pseudonyms, where the identification of the user is not required by Union or 
national law.

requirements.requirement: Implement and perform authentication and validation procedures
requirements.explanation:
Relying parties have the legal responsibility for properly authenticating and validating 
person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes. This is not optional - 
the RP must actively perform these procedures correctly.
requirements.legalText:
Relying parties shall be responsible for carrying out the procedure for authenticating 
and validating person identification data and electronic attestation of attributes 
requested from European Digital Identity Wallets.

requirements.requirement: Intermediaries acting on behalf of RPs must not store transaction content data
requirements.explanation:
When an intermediary (e.g., a payment processor, integration platform) acts on behalf 
of a relying party, they are deemed to be relying parties themselves and are prohibited 
from storing data about the content of the transaction.
requirements.legalText:
Intermediaries acting on behalf of relying parties shall be deemed to be relying 
parties and shall not store data about the content of the transaction.

requirements.requirement: Provide complete Annex I information to national register
requirements.explanation:
When registering, relying parties must provide all required information as specified 
in Annex I of 2025/848, including identifiers, contact details, service descriptions, 
intended data requests, and entitlement types.
requirements.legalText:
Wallet-relying parties shall at least provide the information set out in Annex I 
to national registers.

requirements.requirement: Ensure registration information accuracy
requirements.explanation:
Relying parties are legally responsible for ensuring all information provided 
during registration is accurate at the time of registration. Inaccurate information 
may lead to registration suspension or cancellation.
requirements.legalText:
Wallet-relying parties shall ensure that the information provided is accurate 
at the time of registration.

requirements.requirement: Update registration information without undue delay
requirements.explanation:
When any registered information changes (contact details, intended data requests, 
entitlements, etc.), relying parties must update their registration promptly. 
This ensures users and supervisory authorities have accurate information.
requirements.legalText:
Wallet-relying parties shall update any information previously registered in the 
national register of wallet-relying parties without undue delay.

requirements.requirement: Notify registrar when ceasing wallet use
requirements.explanation:
When a relying party decides to stop using wallets for service provision under 
a specific registration, they must promptly notify the registrar and request 
cancellation of that registration.
requirements.legalText:
When a wallet-relying party no longer intends to rely upon wallet units for the 
provision of public or private services under a specific registration, it shall 
notify the relevant registrar without undue delay and request the cancellation 
of that registration.

requirements.requirement: Register appropriate entitlement type
requirements.explanation:
Relying parties must register with the correct entitlement type(s) as defined 
in Annex I, such as 'Service_Provider', 'QEAA_Provider', 'PID_Provider', etc. 
This determines what operations the RP is authorized to perform.
requirements.legalText:
The entitlement or entitlements of the wallet-relying party, that shall be 
expressed as: (a) 'Service_Provider' to express the entitlement of the 
wallet-relying party as a provider of services; (b) 'QEAA_Provider'... 
[and other entitlement types as specified in Annex I, point 12]

requirements.requirement: Provide machine-readable intended data requests
requirements.explanation:
For each intended use, relying parties must provide a detailed list of requested 
data including attestations and attributes in both user-friendly and technical 
formats for automated processing.
requirements.legalText:
