together with a conformity assessment report issued by a conformity
assessment body confirming the fulfilment of the requirements laid down
in this Regulation and in Article 21 of Directive (EU) 2022/2555.

requirements.requirement: Begin qualified services only after trusted list inclusion
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs may only begin providing qualified trust services after their
qualified status has been indicated in the trusted lists.
requirements.legalText:
Qualified trust service providers may begin to provide the qualified
trust service after the qualified status has been indicated in the
trusted lists referred to in Article 22(1).

requirements.requirement: Provide link to trusted list when using EU trust mark
requirements.explanation:
When using the EU trust mark, QTSPs must ensure a link to the relevant
trusted list is made available on their website.
requirements.legalText:
When using the EU trust mark for the qualified trust services referred
to in paragraph 1, qualified trust service providers shall ensure that
a link to the relevant trusted list is made available on their website.

requirements.requirement: Verify identity when issuing qualified certificates/attestations
requirements.explanation:
When issuing qualified certificates or attestations, QTSPs must verify
the identity and any specific attributes of the person.
requirements.legalText:
When issuing a qualified certificate or a qualified electronic attestation
of attributes, a qualified trust service provider shall verify the identity
and, if applicable, any specific attributes of the natural or legal person
to whom the qualified certificate or the qualified electronic attestation
of attributes is to be issued.

requirements.requirement: Use approved methods for identity verification
requirements.explanation:
Identity verification must be performed using approved methods: EUDI Wallet,
notified eID means (LoA high), qualified signature/seal certificate,
CAB-confirmed methods, or physical presence with evidence.
requirements.legalText:
The verification of the identity shall be performed by the qualified
trust service provider on the basis of one of the following methods:
(a) by means of the European Digital Identity Wallet or a notified
electronic identification means which meets LoA high; (b) by means of
a certificate of a qualified electronic signature or seal; (c) using
other identification methods confirmed by a conformity assessment body;
(d) through physical presence with appropriate evidence and procedures.

requirements.requirement: Notify supervisory body 1 month before changes, 3 months before cessation
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must inform the supervisory body at least one month before any
change to qualified services, or three months before ceasing activities.
requirements.legalText:
A qualified trust service provider providing qualified trust services
shall inform the supervisory body at least one month before implementing
any change in the provision of its qualified trust services or at least
three months in case of an intention to cease those activities.

requirements.requirement: Employ qualified and trained staff
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must employ staff with necessary expertise, reliability, experience,
and qualifications, who have received appropriate security and data
protection training.
requirements.legalText:
Employ staff and, if applicable, subcontractors who possess the necessary
expertise, reliability, experience, and qualifications and who have
received appropriate training regarding security and personal data
protection rules and shall apply administrative and management procedures
which correspond to European or international standards.

requirements.requirement: Maintain sufficient financial resources or liability insurance
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must maintain sufficient financial resources and/or appropriate
liability insurance to cover potential damages.
requirements.legalText:
With regard to the risk of liability for damages in accordance with
Article 13, maintain sufficient financial resources and/or obtain
appropriate liability insurance, in accordance with national law.

requirements.requirement: Publish clear terms and conditions before contractual relationship
requirements.explanation:
Before entering into a contractual relationship, QTSPs must inform
persons seeking to use a qualified service of the precise terms and
conditions, including any limitations.
requirements.legalText:
Before entering into a contractual relationship, inform, in a clear,
comprehensive and easily accessible manner, in a publicly accessible
space and individually any person seeking to use a qualified trust
service of the precise terms and conditions regarding the use of that
service, including any limitations on its use.

requirements.requirement: Use trustworthy systems and products with suitable cryptography
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must use trustworthy systems protected against modification,
ensuring technical security and using suitable cryptographic techniques.
requirements.legalText:
Use trustworthy systems and products that are protected against
modification and ensure the technical security and reliability of
the processes supported by them, including using suitable cryptographic
techniques.

requirements.requirement: Use secure data storage with access controls
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must use trustworthy systems to store data in verifiable form,
with consent-based public retrieval, authorized-only modifications,
and authenticity checking.
requirements.legalText:
Use trustworthy systems to store data provided to it, in a verifiable
form so that: (i) they are publicly available for retrieval only where
consent has been obtained, (ii) only authorised persons can make entries
and changes to the stored data, (iii) the data can be checked for authenticity.

requirements.requirement: Implement comprehensive risk management policies
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must have appropriate policies and measures to manage legal,
business, operational and other risks, including registration,
procedural checks, and service management.
requirements.legalText:
Have appropriate policies and take corresponding measures to manage
legal, business, operational and other direct or indirect risks to the
provision of the qualified trust service, including at least measures
related to: (i) registration and onboarding procedures; (ii) procedural
or administrative checks; (iii) management and implementation of services.

requirements.requirement: Notify security breaches and service disruptions within 24 hours
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must notify the supervisory body, affected individuals, and
(upon request) the public of security breaches or service disruptions
with significant impact, within 24 hours.
requirements.legalText:
Notify the supervisory body, the identifiable affected individuals,
other relevant competent bodies where applicable and, at the request
of the supervisory body, the public if it is of public interest, of
any security breaches or disruptions in the provision of the service...
that have a significant impact on the trust service provided or on the
personal data maintained therein, without undue delay and in any event
within 24 hours of the incident.

requirements.requirement: Protect against forgery, theft and data alteration
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must take appropriate measures against forgery, theft,
misappropriation, or unauthorized deletion/alteration of data.
requirements.legalText:
Take appropriate measures against forgery, theft or misappropriation
of data or, without right, deleting, altering or rendering data inaccessible.

requirements.requirement: Retain relevant information for evidence and service continuity
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must record and keep accessible all relevant information about
data issued and received, for evidence in legal proceedings and
service continuity, even after ceasing activities.
requirements.legalText:
Record and keep accessible for as long as necessary after the activities
of the qualified trust service provider have ceased, all relevant
information concerning data issued and received by the qualified trust
service provider, for the purpose of providing evidence in legal
proceedings and for the purpose of ensuring continuity of the service.

requirements.requirement: Maintain up-to-date termination plan
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must have an up-to-date termination plan to ensure service
continuity, verified by the supervisory body.
requirements.legalText:
Have an up-to-date termination plan to ensure the continuity of service
in accordance with provisions that are verified by the supervisory body
pursuant to Article 46b(4), point (i).

requirements.requirement: Ensure lawful processing of personal data
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must ensure lawful processing of personal data in accordance
with GDPR.
requirements.legalText:
Ensure lawful processing of personal data in accordance with
Directive 95/46/EC [now Regulation (EU) 2016/679 - GDPR].

requirements.requirement: Establish and maintain certificate database
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs issuing qualified certificates must establish and keep updated
a certificate database.
requirements.legalText:
In case of qualified trust service providers issuing qualified
certificates, establish and keep updated a certificate database.

requirements.requirement: Publish certificate revocation within 24 hours
requirements.explanation:
When revoking a qualified certificate, QTSPs must register the revocation
and publish the status in a timely manner, within 24 hours of receiving
the request. Revocation becomes effective immediately upon publication.
requirements.legalText:
If a qualified trust service provider issuing qualified certificates
decides to revoke a certificate, it shall register such revocation in
its certificate database and publish the revocation status of the
certificate in a timely manner, and in any event within 24 hours after
the receipt of the request. The revocation shall become effective
immediately upon its publication.

requirements.requirement: Provide free certificate validity status information
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must provide relying parties with certificate validity/revocation
status information, available per-certificate, at any time beyond
validity period, automated, reliable, and free of charge.
requirements.legalText:
Qualified trust service providers issuing qualified certificates shall
provide to any relying party information on the validity or revocation
status of qualified certificates issued by them. This information shall
be made available at least on a per certificate basis at any time and
beyond the validity period of the certificate in an automated manner
that is reliable, free of charge and efficient.

requirements.requirement: Only generate/manage signature creation data on behalf of signatory
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs providing remote QSCD management must only generate or manage
electronic signature creation data on behalf of the signatory.
requirements.legalText:
The management of remote qualified electronic signature creation devices
as a qualified service shall be carried out only by a qualified trust
service provider that generates or manages electronic signature creation
data on behalf of the signatory.

requirements.requirement: Limit data duplication to minimum needed for service continuity
requirements.explanation:
When duplicating signature creation data for backup, QTSPs must ensure
same security level as originals and limit copies to minimum needed
for service continuity.
requirements.legalText:
Duplicates the electronic signature creation data for back-up purposes
only, provided that: (i) the security of the duplicated datasets must
be at the same level as for the original datasets; (ii) the number of
duplicated datasets must not exceed the minimum needed to ensure
continuity of the service.

requirements.requirement: Include all required elements in qualified signature certificates
requirements.explanation:
Qualified certificates for electronic signatures must contain all
elements specified in Annex I: qualified certificate indication,
provider identification, signatory name, validation data, validity
period, unique identity code, advanced signature/seal of issuer,
certificate location, status service location, and QSCD indication.

requirements.requirement: Ensure QSCD meets security requirements
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must ensure qualified signature creation devices meet
requirements: confidentiality of creation data, single-use occurrence,
protection against derivation, and protection against unauthorized use.

requirements.requirement: Ensure QSCD does not alter data to be signed
requirements.explanation:
Qualified signature creation devices must not alter the data to be
signed or prevent such data from being presented to the signatory
prior to signing.
requirements.legalText:
Qualified electronic signature creation devices shall not alter the
data to be signed or prevent such data from being presented to the
signatory prior to signing.

requirements.requirement: Only QTSPs may generate/manage signature creation data
requirements.explanation:
Generating or managing electronic signature creation data on behalf
of the signatory may only be done by a qualified trust service provider.
requirements.legalText:
Generating or managing electronic signature creation data on behalf
of the signatory may only be done by a qualified trust service provider.

requirements.requirement: Include all required elements in qualified seal certificates
requirements.explanation:
Qualified certificates for electronic seals must contain all elements
specified in Annex III, paralleling requirements for signature
certificates but for legal persons creating seals.

requirements.requirement: Include all required elements in qualified website certificates
requirements.explanation:
Qualified certificates for website authentication must contain all
elements specified in Annex IV, including domain names and address.

requirements.requirement: Include all required elements in qualified attestations of attributes
requirements.explanation:
Qualified electronic attestations of attributes must contain all
elements specified in Annex V, including attestation indication,
provider identification, entity identification, attested attributes,
validity period, unique identity code, qualified signature/seal,
certificate location, and status service location.

requirements.requirement: Notify supervisory body of significant changes (10 categories)
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must notify supervisory bodies of significant changes to:
(a) service descriptions/policies/T&Cs, (b) technical architecture,
(c) hosting, (d) cryptography, (e) registration/identification,
(f) organisation/governance, (g) termination plan, (h) financial/insurance,
(i) trusted list content, (j) third parties/subcontractors.

requirements.requirement: Include required content in change notifications
requirements.explanation:
Notifications of changes must include: description of the change,
planned date and time, reasons for the change with evidence (if applicable),
and updated documents where applicable.

requirements.requirement: Apply risk management framework per 2025/2160
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must apply the risk management requirements set out in Articles 2,
3, and 4 of Implementing Regulation 2025/2160 (non-qualified TSP risk
management framework applies to QTSPs as well).
requirements.legalText:
The requirements laid down in Article 2, Article 3 and Article 4 of
Commission Implementing Regulation 2025/2160 shall apply.

requirements.requirement: Establish termination plan for each qualified trust service
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must establish a termination plan for each qualified trust service,
covering service continuity, evidence provision, and how information
is kept accessible.
requirements.legalText:
Qualified trust service providers shall establish a termination plan for
each qualified trust service they provide, that establishes the necessary
provisions for the effective and correct application of the termination
of the service or parts thereof, for the purposes of ensuring continuity
of the service and of providing evidence in legal proceedings.

requirements.requirement: Establish controls for termination plan document availability
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must set up controls and procedures to ensure availability for
internal use of documented policies, practices, procedures, third party
arrangements, and other documents required for termination plan effectiveness.
requirements.legalText:
Qualified trust service providers shall set up controls and procedures to
ensure the availability for internal use of documented policies, practices,
procedures, third party arrangements and any other documents required to
ensure the effectiveness of the termination plan.

requirements.requirement: Keep termination plan and documents up to date
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must set up controls and procedures to ensure their termination
plan and any associated documents are kept up to date.
requirements.legalText:
Qualified trust service providers shall set up controls and procedures
to ensure that their termination plan and any document associated with
it are up to date.

requirements.requirement: Review termination plan at least every two years
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must review the termination plan and associated documents at
least every two years, and as part of implementing any changes to
the QTSP or its services, updating the plan accordingly.
requirements.legalText:
Qualified trust service providers shall review the termination plan,
and any associated documents, at least every two years and as part
of the implementation of any changes to the qualified trust service
provider or to the qualified trust services it provides and update
the termination plan accordingly.

requirements.requirement: Manage termination-specific risks in risk framework
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must manage the risks specific to termination of their qualified
trust services as part of the overall risk management framework.
requirements.legalText:
Qualified trust service providers shall manage the risks that are
specific to the termination of the provision of their qualified trust
services as part of the risk management framework referred to in Article 2.

requirements.requirement: Maintain financial resources to cover termination costs
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must ensure maintenance of sufficient financial resources or
appropriate insurance to cover the costs required to effectively execute
the termination plan, including in case of unanticipated termination.
requirements.legalText:
Qualified trust service providers shall ensure maintenance of sufficient
financial resources or obtain appropriate insurance to cover the costs
required to effectively execute the termination plan, including in case
of unanticipated termination.

requirements.requirement: Include 9 specific procedures in termination plan
requirements.explanation:
Termination plans must specify procedures for: (a) terminating services
and decommissioning technical components, (b) updating trusted lists,
(c) certificate revocation, (d) preventing further service output,
(e) ensuring record accessibility, (f) addressing anticipated/unanticipated
scenarios, (g) safeguarding subscriber interests, (h) alternative service
arrangements, (i) notifying affected parties.

requirements.requirement: Ensure record accessibility for evidence and continuity
requirements.explanation:
Termination plan procedures must ensure accessibility and usability of
records necessary to: (a) provide evidence of compliance with eIDAS and
GDPR, (b) ensure service continuity regarding validation data and
verification of previously created trust service outputs.
requirements.legalText:
The procedures and arrangements referred to in paragraph 7, point (e)
shall ensure the accessibility and usability of the records necessary to:
(a) provide evidence in relation to the compliance of the qualified trust
services with Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 and Regulation (EU) 2016/679;
(b) ensure continuity of the qualified trust services, as regards the
signature or seal validation data of the qualified trust service provider
and as regards enabling continued maintenance of information required to
verify the correctness of previously created trust service outputs.

requirements.requirement: Maintain 5 types of termination documentation
requirements.explanation:
Termination plan and associated records must include: (a) procedures
for termination, (b) records of regular plan reviews, (c) audit reports
on termination plan, (d) termination arrangements with third parties,
(e) T&Cs, practices and policy documents for the services.

requirements.requirement: Comply with service-specific ETSI standards per Annex
requirements.explanation:
In addition to Arts 1-3 requirements, QTSPs must comply with the
reference standards and specifications for their specific qualified
trust service type(s) as set out in the Annex to 2025/2530.
requirements.legalText:
In addition to the requirements set out in Article 1, Article 2 and
Article 3, the reference standards and specifications referred to in
Article 24(5) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 are set out in the Annex
to this Regulation.

requirements.requirement: Establish management-approved risk management policies
requirements.explanation:
Non-qualified TSPs must establish risk management policies that 
clearly identify applicable trust services, are service-specific,
and are approved by the management body.
requirements.legalText:
The risk management policies referred to in Article 19a(1) of Regulation
(EU) No 910/2014 shall clearly identify the trust services they apply to,
shall be specific to the trust services concerned and shall be approved
by the management body of the non-qualified trust service provider.

requirements.requirement: Include 6 mandatory elements in risk management policies
requirements.explanation:
Risk management policies must include: (a) risk tolerance level,
(b) risk criteria (likelihood, impact, level), (c) risk identification
approach, (d) risk evaluation process, (e) risk treatment process,
(f) continuous monitoring process.

requirements.requirement: Identify, document and evaluate all risks
requirements.explanation:
Non-qualified TSPs must identify, document and evaluate all risks,
including third-party risks and potential single points of failure.
requirements.legalText:
Non-qualified trust service providers shall identify, document and
evaluate all risks in accordance with the risk management policies,
and shall in particular: (a) identify risks in relation to third parties;
(b) identify potential single point of failure; (c) evaluate risks
based on risk criteria.

requirements.requirement: Plan, document and implement risk treatment measures
requirements.explanation:
Non-qualified TSPs must plan, document and implement risk treatment
measures including prioritisation, approval, documentation in a risk
treatment plan, and continuous monitoring.
requirements.legalText:
Non-qualified trust service providers shall plan, document and implement
risk treatment measures, and shall: (a) identify and prioritise appropriate
measures; (b) select, approve and document measures in a risk treatment
plan; (c) continuously monitor implementation.

requirements.requirement: Publish identity verification methods used
requirements.explanation:
Non-qualified TSPs must verify user identity (directly or via third party)
and publish information on the identity verification methods used.
requirements.legalText:
As part of risk treatment measures, non-qualified trust service providers
shall verify, where applicable, the identity of the users of the trust
service directly or by means of a third party and publish information
on the identity verification methods used.

requirements.requirement: Record and retain user registration and authentication data
requirements.explanation:
Non-qualified TSPs must record and securely retain: (i) registration/
onboarding information including identity verification, (ii) authentication
data, (iii) status changes of certificates or cryptographic material.
requirements.legalText:
Non-qualified trust service providers shall record and securely retain
for as long as necessary: all relevant information collected in registration
and onboarding, authentication data assigned to users, and any change
of status of public key certificates or cryptographic material.

requirements.requirement: Review and update risk evaluation annually
requirements.explanation:
Non-qualified TSPs must review, document, and update risk evaluation
results and risk treatment plan at least annually, and whenever
significant changes or incidents occur.
requirements.legalText:
Non-qualified trust service providers shall review, document and, where
appropriate, update the risk evaluation results and the risk treatment
plan at planned intervals, and at least annually, and when significant
changes to infrastructure, operations or risks, or significant incidents, occur.

requirements.requirement: Comply with ETSI EN 319 401 for attestation issuance
requirements.explanation:
Providers of qualified electronic attestations of attributes must
comply with ETSI EN 319 401 specifications for trust service providers.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of qualified electronic attestations of attributes shall issue
their attestations to natural or legal persons according to the 
specifications for trust service providers established in standard
ETSI EN 319 401 v3.1.1 (2024-06).

requirements.requirement: Issue attestations in specified formats per 2024/2979
requirements.explanation:
QEAA providers must issue attestations in formats according to the
standards listed in Annex II of 2024/2979 (wallet integrity).
requirements.legalText:
Providers of qualified electronic attestations of attributes shall issue
their attestations in a format according to one of the standards listed
in Annex II of Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979.

requirements.requirement: Maintain public revocation policies
requirements.explanation:
QEAA providers must have written, publicly accessible policies for
validity/revocation status management, including revocation conditions
and measures for status information availability.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of qualified electronic attestations of attributes shall have
written and publicly accessible policies relating to validity or 
revocation status management, including conditions for revocation
and measures for ensuring availability of validity status information.

requirements.requirement: Revoke attestations in specified circumstances
requirements.explanation:
For attestations with >24h validity, QEAA providers must revoke them
upon: (a) explicit user request, (b) known security/trustworthiness
compromise, (c) as required by law or provider policies.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of QEAAs, for attestations with validity >24 hours, shall
revoke them in at least: (a) upon explicit request of the person;
(b) where known compromise of security or trustworthiness; (c) as
required by Union or national law, or as determined in their policies.

requirements.requirement: Use privacy-preserving revocation techniques
requirements.explanation:
QEAA providers must set up revocation techniques and management
methods that are privacy preserving and hinder linkability or traceability.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of QEAAs shall set up revocation techniques and management
methods that are privacy preserving and hindering linkability or 
traceability.

requirements.requirement: Provide integrity-assured validity status information
requirements.explanation:
QEAA providers must make validity/revocation status information
available to relying parties with integrity and authenticity assurance.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of QEAAs shall make available to relying parties information
on the validity or revocation status of the electronic attestations
they have issued in a manner that ensures the integrity and authenticity
of that information.

requirements.requirement: Comply with ETSI identity verification standards
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs issuing qualified certificates or QEAAs must verify identity
in conformance with ETSI TS 119 461 and its adaptations.
requirements.legalText:
The reference standards and specifications referred to in Article 24(1c)
of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 are set out in the Annex (ETSI TS 119 461).

requirements.requirement: Use accredited CABs for biometric verification assessment
requirements.explanation:
When using automated identity proofing, CABs assessing the process must
be accredited per Article 3(18) of 910/2014, with formal certification
based on security evaluation per eID LoA or EUDI Wallet standards.
requirements.legalText:
The independent conformity assessment body shall be accredited as per
Article 3(18) of 910/2014, and the assessment should result in a
certificate of compliance based on certification audit with rigorous
security testing against potential threats.

requirements.requirement: Establish FAR/FRR targets for automated identity proofing
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs using fully automated identity proofing must establish target
values for False Acceptance Rate and False Rejection Rate based on
risk analysis and threat intelligence, using ENISA methodology.
requirements.legalText:
The IPSP shall establish target values for the FAR and FRR, based on
a risk analysis and its threats intelligence procedure, by following
the methodology established in the ENISA report 'Methodology for
sectoral cybersecurity assessments' or equivalent methodology.

requirements.requirement: Test identity document validation measures every 2 years
requirements.explanation:
Effectiveness of identity document validation measures must be tested
by an accredited laboratory or national competent authority by
August 2027 and then repeated every two years.
requirements.legalText:
The effectiveness of measures for complying with identity document
validation requirements shall be tested by an accredited laboratory
or national competent authority, at latest by 19 August 2027 and
then be repeated every second year.

requirements.requirement: Comply with ETSI remote QSCD management standards
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs providing remote QSCD management services must comply with
ETSI TS 119 431-1 (EU Server Signing Application Service v2 Policy).
requirements.legalText:
The reference standards and specifications for the management of remote
qualified electronic signature creation devices and remote qualified
electronic seal creation devices are set out in the Annex (ETSI TS 119 431-1).

requirements.requirement: Make service information publicly and internationally available
requirements.explanation:
Remote QSCD management service providers must make required information
(practice statements, policies) publicly and internationally available.
requirements.legalText:
The information identified in OVR-6.1-01 above shall be publicly and
internationally available.

requirements.requirement: Use ENISA-compliant cryptographic techniques
requirements.explanation:
Remote QSCD management providers must use cryptographic techniques
compliant with ENISA Agreed Cryptographic Mechanisms.
requirements.legalText:
The SSASP shall select and use suitable cryptographic techniques
compliant with the Agreed Cryptographic Mechanisms endorsed by the
European Cybersecurity Certification Group and published by ENISA.

requirements.requirement: Include QSCD certification reference in practice statement
requirements.explanation:
Remote QSCD management providers must include in their practice
statement the reference to the certification of the employed QSCD.
requirements.legalText:
The TSP's practice statement shall include the reference to the
certification of the employed QSCD in accordance with the requirements
of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014, Annex II.

requirements.requirement: Provide 8 mandatory information items when notifying intention
requirements.explanation:
TSPs intending to start qualified services must provide comprehensive
information in their notification including legal entity details,
contact info, URIs, risk analysis, service types, and termination plan.
requirements.legalText:
Trust service providers shall provide at least: (1) legal person name/
registration; (2) natural person ID; (3) contact details; (4) URIs for
policies and statements; (5) risk analysis per Art. 24(2)(fa) and
NIS2 Art. 21; (6) each qualified trust service intended; (7) service
details; (8) termination plan per Art. 24(2)(i).

requirements.requirement: Maintain signature/seal trustworthiness beyond validity period
requirements.explanation:
Qualified archiving providers must ensure qualified signatures/seals
remain trustworthy beyond their technological validity period,
maintaining integrity and accuracy of origin throughout preservation.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of qualified electronic archiving services shall ensure that
the trustworthiness of qualified electronic signatures or seals is
maintained, including beyond their technological validity period, and
that integrity and accuracy of origin is maintained, at least until
the end of the legal or contractual preservation period.

requirements.requirement: Comply with CEN/TS 18170 archiving standards
requirements.explanation:
Qualified archiving providers must comply with CEN/TS 18170 standard
with specified adaptations, including OAIS reference model.
requirements.legalText:
The reference standards and specifications are set out in the Annex:
CEN/TS 18170:2025 applies with adaptations including references to
ETSI EN 319401, ETSI EN 319421, ISO 14721:2025 (OAIS), and ENISA
Agreed Cryptographic Mechanisms.

requirements.requirement: Inform subscribers clearly before entering contractual relationship
requirements.explanation:
Archiving providers must inform subscribers and relying parties
of terms and conditions in a clear, comprehensive, and easily
accessible manner before entering into a contractual relationship.
requirements.legalText:
Subscribers and parties relying on the electronic archiving trust
service shall be informed, in a clear, comprehensive and easily
accessible manner, in a publicly accessible space and individually,
of precise terms and conditions, before entering into a contractual
relationship.

requirements.requirement: Use qualified signatures/seals when establishing data origin
requirements.explanation:
When establishing the origin of data to be archived, if archiving
providers use electronic signatures or seals, those must be qualified.
requirements.legalText:
The origin of the data to be archived in the electronic archiving
system shall be established by the EATSP. If they use electronic
signatures or electronic seals to do so, those electronic signatures
or electronic seals shall be qualified.

requirements.requirement: Use qualified timestamps for archiving events
requirements.explanation:
Qualified archiving providers must use qualified timestamps
when timestamping archiving events.
requirements.legalText: When using timestamps the EATSP shall use a qualified timestamp.

requirements.requirement: Perform quarterly vulnerability scans
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must perform vulnerability scans at least quarterly. This
requirement appears in implementing acts for timestamps, validation,
certificates, registered delivery, archiving, and remote QSCD.
requirements.legalText:
The vulnerability scan requested by REQ-7.8-13 of ETSI EN 319401
shall be performed at least once per quarter.

requirements.requirement: Perform annual penetration tests
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must perform penetration tests at least annually. This
requirement appears in implementing acts for timestamps, validation,
certificates, registered delivery, archiving, and remote QSCD.
requirements.legalText:
The penetration test requested by REQ-7.8-17X of ETSI EN 319401
shall be performed at least once per year.

requirements.requirement: Configure firewalls to prevent unnecessary access
requirements.explanation:
QTSPs must configure firewalls to prevent all protocols and accesses
not required for the operation of the TSP. This is a common
requirement across multiple service-specific implementing acts.
requirements.legalText:
Firewalls shall be configured to prevent all protocols and accesses
not required for the operation of the TSP.

requirements.requirement: Provide annual security training updates to personnel
requirements.explanation:
QTSP personnel in trusted roles must receive regular updates
(at least every 12 months) on new threats and current security
practices. This is a common requirement across all service types.
requirements.legalText:
Compliance shall include regular updates (at least every 12 months)
on new threats and current security practices.

requirements.requirement: Provide at least one European Digital Identity Wallet
requirements.explanation:
Each Member State must ensure the provision of at least one EUDI Wallet. 
Wallet providers acting on behalf of a Member State inherit this obligation.
requirements.legalText:
Each Member State shall provide at least one European Digital Identity Wallet within 
24 months of the date of entry into force of the implementing acts referred to in 
paragraph 23 of this Article and in Article 5c(6).

requirements.requirement: Publish open-source application software components
requirements.explanation:
The source code of wallet application software components must be open-source 
licensed. This promotes transparency, security review, and interoperability.
requirements.legalText:
The source code of the application software components of European Digital Identity 
Wallets shall be open-source licensed. Member States may provide that, for duly 
justified reasons, the source code of specific components other than those installed 
on user devices shall not be disclosed.

requirements.requirement: Enable secure storage, management, and presentation of PID and EAA
requirements.explanation:
The wallet must enable users to securely request, obtain, select, combine, store, 
delete, share and present person identification data and electronic attestations 
of attributes, under sole user control.
requirements.legalText:
European Digital Identity Wallets shall enable the user, in a manner that is 
user-friendly, transparent, and traceable by the user, to: (a) securely request, 
obtain, select, combine, store, delete, share and present, under the sole control 
of the user, person identification data and, where applicable, in combination with 
electronic attestations of attributes, to authenticate to relying parties online 
and, where appropriate, in offline mode, in order to access public and private 
services, while ensuring that selective disclosure of data is possible.

requirements.requirement: Support selective disclosure of data
requirements.explanation:
Users must be able to share only specific attributes rather than full credentials.
This is essential for privacy-preserving identity verification.
requirements.legalText: [...] while ensuring that selective disclosure of data is possible.

requirements.requirement: Support pseudonym generation and encrypted local storage
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must allow users to generate pseudonyms and store them encrypted 
locally within the wallet for privacy-preserving authentication.
requirements.legalText:
European Digital Identity Wallets shall enable the user [...] to: (b) generate 
pseudonyms and store them encrypted and locally within the European Digital 
Identity Wallet.

requirements.requirement: Support wallet-to-wallet authentication and data exchange
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must support secure peer-to-peer authentication, allowing users to 
verify another person's wallet and exchange data directly.
requirements.legalText:
European Digital Identity Wallets shall enable the user [...] to: (c) securely 
authenticate another person's European Digital Identity Wallet, and receive and 
share person identification data and electronic attestations of attributes in a 
secured way between the two European Digital Identity Wallets.

requirements.requirement: Provide transaction log dashboard with RP list and data exchange history
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must provide a dashboard showing all relying parties the user has 
connected with and, where applicable, all data exchanged with each.
requirements.legalText:
European Digital Identity Wallets shall enable the user [...] to: (d) access a 
log of all transactions carried out through the European Digital Identity Wallet 
via a common dashboard enabling the user to: (i) view an up-to-date list of 
relying parties with which the user has established a connection and, where 
applicable, all data exchanged.

requirements.requirement: Enable easy data erasure requests to relying parties
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must provide a mechanism for users to easily request erasure of 
personal data from relying parties (GDPR Article 17 right).
requirements.legalText:
[...] via a common dashboard enabling the user to: (ii) easily request the 
erasure by a relying party of personal data pursuant to Article 17 of the 
Regulation (EU) 2016/679.

requirements.requirement: Enable easy reporting of suspicious RP requests to DPA
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must allow users to easily report relying parties to the competent 
national data protection authority when receiving unlawful or suspicious 
data requests.
requirements.legalText:
[...] via a common dashboard enabling the user to: (iii) easily report a 
relying party to the competent national data protection authority, where an 
allegedly unlawful or suspicious request for data is received.

requirements.requirement: Support qualified electronic signatures and seals
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must enable users to sign by means of qualified electronic signatures 
or seal by means of qualified electronic seals.
requirements.legalText:
European Digital Identity Wallets shall enable the user [...] to: (e) sign by 
means of qualified electronic signatures or seal by means of qualified 
electronic seals.

requirements.requirement: Support data download and export
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must allow users to download their data, electronic attestations 
of attributes, and configurations to the extent technically feasible.
requirements.legalText:
European Digital Identity Wallets shall enable the user [...] to: (f) download, 
to the extent technically feasible, the user's data, electronic attestation of 
attributes and configurations.

requirements.requirement: Support data portability rights
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must enable users to exercise their rights to data portability 
as provided under GDPR.
requirements.legalText:
European Digital Identity Wallets shall enable the user [...] to: (g) exercise 
the user's rights to data portability.

requirements.requirement: Support common protocols for PID and EAA issuance
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must support common protocols and interfaces for issuance of person 
identification data and electronic attestations of attributes.
requirements.legalText:
European Digital Identity Wallets shall, in particular: (a) support common 
protocols and interfaces: (i) for issuance of person identification data, 
qualified and non-qualified electronic attestations of attributes or qualified 
and non-qualified certificates to the European Digital Identity Wallet.

requirements.requirement: Support common protocols for RP attribute requests and validation
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must support protocols allowing relying parties to request and 
validate person identification data and electronic attestations.
requirements.legalText:
[...] (ii) for relying parties to request and validate person identification 
data and electronic attestations of attributes.

requirements.requirement: Support online and offline presentation protocols
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must support protocols for sharing and presenting data to relying 
parties both online and, where appropriate, in offline mode.
requirements.legalText:
[...] (iii) for the sharing and presentation to relying parties of person 
identification data, electronic attestation of attributes or of selectively 
disclosed related data online and, where appropriate, in offline mode.

requirements.requirement: Display EU Digital Identity Wallet Trust Mark
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must support protocols allowing users to interact with the wallet 
and display the EU Digital Identity Wallet Trust Mark.
requirements.legalText:
[...] (iv) for the user to allow interaction with the European Digital 
Identity Wallet and display an EU Digital Identity Wallet Trust Mark.

requirements.requirement: Support secure user onboarding via eID means
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must support protocols for securely onboarding users using 
electronic identification means at the required assurance level.
requirements.legalText:
[...] (v) to securely onboard the user by using an electronic identification 
means in accordance with Article 5a(24).

requirements.requirement: Support wallet-to-wallet interaction protocols
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must support protocols for secure interaction between two persons' 
wallets for receiving, validating and sharing data.
requirements.legalText:
[...] (vi) for interaction between two persons' European Digital Identity Wallets 
for the purpose of receiving, validating and sharing person identification data 
and electronic attestations of attributes in a secure manner.

requirements.requirement: Implement RP authentication and identification mechanisms
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must support protocols for authenticating and identifying relying 
parties according to Article 5b mechanisms.
requirements.legalText:
[...] (vii) for authenticating and identifying relying parties by implementing 
authentication mechanisms in accordance with Article 5b.

requirements.requirement: Support RP verification of wallet authenticity and validity
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must support protocols allowing relying parties to verify the 
authenticity and validity of European Digital Identity Wallets.
requirements.legalText:
[...] (viii) for relying parties to verify the authenticity and validity of 
European Digital Identity Wallets.

requirements.requirement: Support data erasure request protocols
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must support protocols for requesting erasure of personal data 
from relying parties pursuant to GDPR Article 17.
requirements.legalText:
[...] (ix) for requesting a relying party the erasure of personal data 
pursuant to Article 17 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679.

requirements.requirement: Support DPA reporting protocols
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must support protocols for reporting relying parties to national 
data protection authorities for suspicious data requests.
requirements.legalText:
[...] (x) for reporting a relying party to the competent national data 
protection authority where an allegedly unlawful or suspicious request 
for data is received.

requirements.requirement: Support qualified signature and seal creation device protocols
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must support protocols for creating qualified electronic signatures 
or seals using qualified signature or seal creation devices.
requirements.legalText:
[...] (xi) for the creation of qualified electronic signatures or electronic 
seals by means of qualified electronic signature or electronic seal creation 
devices.

requirements.requirement: Do not provide EAA usage information to attestation issuers
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must not provide any information to trust service providers about 
how their electronic attestations of attributes are used after issuance.
requirements.legalText:
European Digital Identity Wallets shall, in particular: [...] (b) not provide 
any information to trust service providers of electronic attestations of 
attributes about the use of those electronic attestations.

requirements.requirement: Ensure user has full control over wallet use and data
requirements.explanation:
Users must have full control of the use of and data in their wallet. 
The provider must not collect unnecessary information or combine data 
without express user request.
requirements.legalText:
Users shall have full control of the use of and of the data in their European 
Digital Identity Wallet. The provider of the European Digital Identity Wallet 
shall neither collect information about the use of the European Digital Identity 
Wallet which is not necessary for the provision of European Digital Identity 
Wallet services, nor combine person identification data or any other personal 
data stored or relating to the use of the European Digital Identity Wallet with 
personal data from any other services offered by that provider or from third-party 
services which are not necessary for the provision of European Digital Identity 
Wallet services, unless the user has expressly requested otherwise.

requirements.requirement: Keep wallet personal data logically separate from other services
requirements.explanation:
Personal data relating to the provision of the wallet must be kept logically 
separate from any other data held by the wallet provider.
requirements.legalText:
Personal data relating to the provision of the European Digital Identity Wallet 
shall be kept logically separate from any other data held by the provider of 
the European Digital Identity Wallet.

requirements.requirement: Private providers: Implement wallet services functionally separate from other services
requirements.explanation:
Private wallet providers (mandated or independent) must implement the provision 
of wallet services in a manner that is functionally separate from other services 
they provide. This goes beyond logical data separation to require organizational 
and technical separation of the wallet business unit itself. This requirement 
does NOT apply to wallets provided directly by Member States.
requirements.legalText:
If the European Digital Identity Wallet is provided by private parties in 
accordance with paragraph 2, points (b) and (c), of this Article, the provisions 
of Article 45h(3) shall apply mutatis mutandis.

Article 45h(3): Providers of qualified electronic attestation of attributes' 
services shall implement the provision of such qualified trust services in a 
manner that is functionally separate from other services provided by them.

requirements.requirement: Prevent tracking and correlation by EAA providers
requirements.explanation:
The technical framework must not allow EAA providers to track transactions 
or user behaviour after attestation issuance unless explicitly authorized.
requirements.legalText:
The technical framework of the European Digital Identity Wallet shall: (a) not 
allow providers of electronic attestations of attributes or any other party, 
after the issuance of the attestation of attributes, to obtain data that allows 
transactions or user behaviour to be tracked, linked or correlated, or knowledge 
of transactions or user behaviour to be otherwise obtained, unless explicitly 
authorised by the user.

requirements.requirement: Enable privacy-preserving techniques for unlinkability
requirements.explanation:
The wallet must enable privacy-preserving techniques ensuring unlinkability 
where the attestation does not require user identification.
requirements.legalText:
The technical framework of the European Digital Identity Wallet shall: [...] 
(b) enable privacy preserving techniques which ensure unlinkability, where 
the attestation of attributes does not require the identification of the user.

requirements.requirement: Process personal data in compliance with GDPR
requirements.explanation:
Any processing of personal data by wallet providers must comply with 
Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and implement appropriate data protection measures.
requirements.legalText:
Any processing of personal data carried out by the Member States or on their 
behalf by bodies or parties responsible for the provision of European Digital 
Identity Wallets as electronic identification means shall be carried out in 
accordance with appropriate and effective data protection measures. Compliance 
of such processing with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 shall be demonstrated.

requirements.requirement: Provide wallets under assurance level high
requirements.explanation:
European Digital Identity Wallets must be provided under an electronic 
identification scheme with assurance level high.
requirements.legalText:
European Digital Identity Wallets shall be provided under an electronic 
identification scheme with assurance level high.

requirements.requirement: Ensure security-by-design
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must ensure security-by-design, integrating security considerations 
throughout the development and operation lifecycle.
requirements.legalText: European Digital Identity Wallets shall ensure security-by-design.

requirements.requirement: Notify users of security breaches without delay
requirements.explanation:
Wallet providers must inform users without delay of any security breach that 
could have compromised their wallet or its contents.
requirements.legalText:
Member State shall inform users, without delay, of any security breach that 
could have entirely or partially compromised their European Digital Identity 
Wallet or its contents, in particular if their European Digital Identity Wallet 
has been suspended or revoked pursuant to Article 5e.

requirements.requirement: Ensure wallet validity can be revoked
requirements.explanation:
Wallet providers must ensure revocation capability upon user request, 
security compromise, or death/cessation of the user/legal person.
requirements.legalText:
Member States shall ensure that the validity of the European Digital Identity 
Wallet can be revoked in the following circumstances: (a) upon the explicit 
request of the user; (b) where the security of the European Digital Identity 
Wallet has been compromised; (c) upon the death of the user or cease of activity 
of the legal person.

requirements.requirement: Provide free wallet issuance, use, and revocation to natural persons
requirements.explanation:
The issuance, use, and revocation of wallets must be free of charge 
to all natural persons.
requirements.legalText:
The issuance, use and revocation of the European Digital Identity Wallets 
shall be free of charge to all natural persons.

requirements.requirement: Offer free qualified signatures by default to natural persons
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must offer all natural persons the ability to sign by means of 
qualified electronic signatures by default and free of charge.
requirements.legalText:
European Digital Identity Wallets shall, in particular: [...] (g) offer all 
natural persons the ability to sign by means of qualified electronic signatures 
by default and free of charge.

requirements.requirement: Provide technical support and incident reporting mechanisms
requirements.explanation:
Wallet providers must ensure users can easily request technical support and 
report technical problems or incidents affecting wallet use.
requirements.legalText:
Providers of European Digital Identity Wallets shall ensure that users can 
easily request technical support and report technical problems or any other 
incidents having a negative impact on the use of European Digital Identity 
Wallets.

requirements.requirement: Provide free validation mechanisms
requirements.explanation:
Wallet providers must provide validation mechanisms free of charge to verify 
wallet authenticity/validity and allow users to verify RP identity.
requirements.legalText:
Member States shall provide validation mechanisms free-of-charge, in order to: 
(a) ensure that the authenticity and validity of European Digital Identity 
Wallets can be verified; (b) allow users to verify the authenticity and 
validity of the identity of relying parties registered in accordance with 
Article 5b.

requirements.requirement: Ensure unique PID association
requirements.explanation:
Wallet providers must ensure PID uniquely represents the user and is 
associated with that wallet.
requirements.legalText:
European Digital Identity Wallets shall, in particular: [...] (f) ensure that 
the person identification data, which is available from the electronic 
identification scheme under which the European Digital Identity Wallet is 
provided, uniquely represents the natural person, legal person or the natural 
person representing the natural or legal person, and is associated with that 
European Digital Identity Wallet.

requirements.requirement: Make wallets accessible to persons with disabilities
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must be accessible for use by persons with disabilities on an 
equal basis with other users, in accordance with Directive 2019/882.
requirements.legalText:
European Digital Identity Wallets shall be made accessible for use, by persons 
with disabilities, on an equal basis with other users, in accordance with 
Directive (EU) 2019/882 of the European Parliament and of the Council.

requirements.requirement: Notify Commission of wallet framework information
requirements.explanation:
Wallet providers must ensure required information is notified to the 
Commission including responsible bodies and validation mechanisms.
requirements.legalText:
Member States shall, without undue delay, notify the Commission of information 
about: (a) the body responsible for establishing and maintaining the list of 
registered relying parties [...]; (b) the bodies responsible for the provision 
of European Digital Identity Wallets [...]; (c) the bodies responsible for 
ensuring that the person identification data is associated with the European 
Digital Identity Wallet [...]; (d) the mechanism allowing for the validation 
of the person identification data [...]; (e) the mechanism by which to validate 
the authenticity and validity of European Digital Identity Wallets.

requirements.requirement: Implement embedded disclosure policy mechanisms
requirements.explanation:
When EAA has embedded disclosure policies, wallets must implement mechanisms 
to inform users when an RP has permission to access such attestations.
requirements.legalText:
European Digital Identity Wallets shall, in particular: [...] (e) in the case 
of the electronic attestation of attributes with embedded disclosure policies, 
implement the appropriate mechanism to inform the user that the relying party 
or the user of the European Digital Identity Wallet requesting that electronic 
attestation of attributes has the permission to access such attestation.

requirements.requirement: Meet assurance level high requirements
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must meet the requirements set out in Article 8 regarding assurance 
level high, particularly for identity proofing, verification, and authentication.
requirements.legalText:
European Digital Identity Wallets shall, in particular: [...] (d) meet the 
requirements set out in Article 8 with regard to assurance level high, in 
particular as applied to the requirements for identity proofing and verification, 
and electronic identification means management and authentication.

requirements.requirement: Authenticate and identify relying parties
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must ensure relying parties can be authenticated and identified 
by implementing authentication mechanisms per Article 5b.
requirements.legalText:
European Digital Identity Wallets shall, in particular: [...] (c) ensure that 
the relying parties can be authenticated and identified by implementing 
authentication mechanisms in accordance with Article 5b.

requirements.requirement: Obtain conformity certification from designated CAB
requirements.explanation:
Wallets must be certified by conformity assessment bodies for compliance 
with Article 5a requirements including functionality, protocols, validation, 
and data separation.
requirements.legalText:
The conformity of European Digital Identity Wallets and the electronic 
identification scheme under which they are provided with the requirements 
laid down in Article 5a(4), (5), (8), the requirement for logical separation 
laid down in Article 5a(14) and, where applicable, with the standards and 
technical specifications referred to in Article 5a(24), shall be certified 
by conformity assessment bodies designated by Member States.

requirements.requirement: Undergo cybersecurity certification
requirements.explanation:
Cybersecurity-relevant requirements must be certified under European 
cybersecurity certification schemes per Regulation 2019/881.
requirements.legalText:
Certification of the conformity of European Digital Identity Wallets with 
requirements referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article, or parts thereof, 
that are relevant for cybersecurity shall be carried out in accordance with 
European cybersecurity certification schemes adopted pursuant to Regulation 
(EU) 2019/881.

requirements.requirement: Maintain valid certification with biennial vulnerability assessments
requirements.explanation:
Certification is valid up to 5 years but requires vulnerability assessment 
every 2 years. Certification is cancelled if vulnerabilities aren't remedied timely.
requirements.legalText:
Certification pursuant to paragraph 1 shall be valid for up to five years, 
provided that a vulnerability assessment is carried out every two years. 
Where a vulnerability is identified and not remedied in a timely manner, 
certification shall be cancelled.

requirements.requirement: Require user authentication before wallet functionality access
requirements.explanation:
Wallet units must not perform any Article 5a(4) functionality except 
user authentication to access the wallet until the user has been 
successfully authenticated.
requirements.legalText:
Wallet units shall not perform any functionality listed in Article 5a(4) 
of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014, except wallet user authentication to 
access the wallet unit, until the wallet unit has successfully 
authenticated the wallet user.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: Sign or seal wallet unit attestations
requirements.explanation:
Wallet providers must sign or seal at least one wallet unit attestation 
per wallet unit, using a certificate from the trusted list.
requirements.legalText:
Wallet providers shall, for each wallet unit, sign or seal, at least 
one wallet unit attestation compliant with the requirements laid down 
in Article 6. The certificate used to sign or seal the wallet unit 
attestation shall be issued under a certificate listed in the trusted 
list referred to in Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2980.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: Use wallet secure cryptographic device for critical assets
requirements.explanation:
Wallet instances must use at least one wallet secure cryptographic 
device (WSCD) to manage critical assets.
requirements.legalText:
Wallet instances shall use at least one wallet secure cryptographic 
device to manage critical assets.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: Ensure secure communication between wallet instances and WSCA
requirements.explanation:
Wallet providers must ensure integrity, authenticity and confidentiality 
of the communication between wallet instances and wallet secure 
cryptographic applications.
requirements.legalText:
Wallet providers shall ensure integrity, authenticity and confidentiality 
of the communication between wallet instances and wallet secure 
cryptographic applications.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: Perform critical asset operations per assurance level high requirements
requirements.explanation:
Where critical assets relate to performing eID at assurance level high, 
wallet cryptographic operations must be performed per Implementing 
Regulation 2015/1502.
requirements.legalText:
Where critical assets relate to performing electronic identification 
at assurance level high, the wallet cryptographic operations or other 
operations processing critical assets shall be performed in accordance 
with the requirements for the characteristics and design of electronic 
identification means at assurance level high, as set out in Commission 
Implementing Regulation (EU) 2015/1502.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: WSCA must perform crypto operations only after user authentication
requirements.explanation:
Wallet secure cryptographic applications must only perform wallet 
cryptographic operations involving critical assets (other than user auth) 
when they have successfully authenticated users.
requirements.legalText:
Wallet providers shall ensure that wallet secure cryptographic applications: 
(a) perform wallet cryptographic operations involving critical assets other 
than those needed for the wallet unit to authenticate the wallet user only 
in cases where those applications have successfully authenticated wallet users.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: WSCA must authenticate users per assurance level high requirements
requirements.explanation:
When performing eID at assurance level high, WSCA must authenticate 
users in accordance with Implementing Regulation 2015/1502.
requirements.legalText:
[...] (b) where they authenticate wallet users in the context of 
performing electronic identification at assurance level high; perform 
authentication of wallet users, in accordance with, the requirements 
for the characteristics and design of electronic identification means 
at assurance level high, as set out in Implementing Regulation (EU) 2015/1502.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: WSCA must support secure key generation
requirements.explanation:
Wallet secure cryptographic applications must be able to securely 
generate new cryptographic keys.
requirements.legalText: [...] (c) are able to securely generate new cryptographic keys.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: WSCA must support secure erasure of critical assets
requirements.explanation:
Wallet secure cryptographic applications must be able to perform 
secure erasure of critical assets.
requirements.legalText: [...] (d) are able to perform secure erasure of critical assets.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: WSCA must support proof of possession of private keys
requirements.explanation:
Wallet secure cryptographic applications must be able to generate 
a proof of possession of private keys.
requirements.legalText: [...] (e) are able to generate a proof of possession of private keys.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: WSCA must protect private keys during their lifetime
requirements.explanation:
Wallet secure cryptographic applications must protect private keys 
generated by those applications during the existence of the keys.
requirements.legalText:
[...] (f) protect the private keys generated by those wallet secure 
cryptographic applications during the existence of the keys.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: WSCA must comply with assurance level high requirements
requirements.explanation:
Wallet secure cryptographic applications must comply with assurance 
level high requirements per Implementing Regulation 2015/1502.
requirements.legalText:
[...] (g) comply with the requirements for the characteristics and 
design of electronic identification means at assurance level high, 
as set out in Implementing Regulation (EU) 2015/1502.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: WSCA must be exclusive executor of critical operations
requirements.explanation:
Wallet secure cryptographic applications must be the only components 
able to execute wallet cryptographic operations and operations with 
critical assets for assurance level high eID.
requirements.legalText:
[...] (h) are the only components able to execute wallet cryptographic 
operations and any other operation with critical assets in the context 
of performing electronic identification at assurance level high.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: Use Annex I standards for embedded secure element WSCA
requirements.explanation:
Where wallet providers provide a WSCA to an embedded secure element, 
they must base technical solutions on Annex I standards (GlobalPlatform, 
GSMA) or equivalent.
requirements.legalText:
Where wallet providers decide to provide a wallet secure cryptographic 
application to an embedded secure element these wallet providers shall 
base their technical solution on the technical specifications listed 
in Annex I or on other equivalent technical specifications.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: Ensure each wallet unit contains wallet unit attestations
requirements.explanation:
Wallet providers must ensure that each wallet unit contains wallet 
unit attestations for verifying authenticity and validity.
requirements.legalText:
Wallet providers shall ensure that each wallet unit contains wallet 
unit attestations.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: Protect WUA private keys with WSCD
requirements.explanation:
Wallet unit attestations must contain public keys with corresponding 
private keys protected by a wallet secure cryptographic device.
requirements.legalText:
Wallet providers shall ensure that the wallet unit attestations 
referred to in paragraph 1 contain public keys and that the 
corresponding private keys are protected by a wallet secure 
cryptographic device.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: Inform users of rights and obligations for wallet unit
requirements.explanation:
Wallet providers must inform wallet users of their rights and 
obligations in relation to their wallet unit.
requirements.legalText:
Wallet providers shall: (a) inform wallet users of their rights 
and obligations in relation to their wallet unit.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: Provide independent user identification/authentication mechanisms
requirements.explanation:
Wallet providers must provide mechanisms, independent of wallet units, 
for the secure identification and authentication of wallet users.
requirements.legalText:
[...] (b) provide mechanisms, independent of wallet units, for the 
secure identification and authentication of wallet users.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: Enable user-requested revocation of WUA
requirements.explanation:
Wallet providers must ensure users can request revocation of their 
wallet unit attestations using the independent authentication mechanisms.
requirements.legalText:
[...] (c) ensure wallet users have the right to request revocation 
of their wallet unit attestations, using the authentication mechanisms 
referred to in point (b).

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: Be sole entity capable of revoking own WUAs
requirements.explanation:
Wallet providers must be the only entities capable of revoking 
wallet unit attestations for wallet units that they have provided.
requirements.legalText:
Wallet providers shall be the only entities capable of revoking 
wallet unit attestations for wallet units that they have provided.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: Publish revocation policy with conditions and timeframe
requirements.explanation:
Wallet providers must establish a publicly available policy 
specifying conditions and timeframe for revocation of WUAs.
requirements.legalText:
Wallet providers shall establish a publicly available policy 
specifying the conditions and the timeframe for the revocation 
of wallet unit attestations.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: Notify users of WUA revocation within 24 hours
requirements.explanation:
When WUAs are revoked, wallet providers must inform affected users 
within 24 hours, including reason and consequences, in clear language.
requirements.legalText:
Where wallet providers have revoked wallet unit attestations, they 
shall inform affected wallet users within 24 hours of the revocation 
of their wallet units, including the reason for the revocation and 
the consequences for the wallet user. This information shall be 
provided in a manner that is concise, easily accessible and using 
clear and plain language.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: Publish WUA validity status in privacy-preserving manner
requirements.explanation:
When WUAs are revoked, providers must make validity status publicly 
available in a privacy-preserving manner and describe its location 
in the WUA.
requirements.legalText:
Where wallet providers have revoked wallet unit attestations, they 
shall make publicly available the validity status of the wallet 
unit attestation in a privacy preserving manner and describe the 
location of that information in the wallet unit attestation.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: Support ISO/IEC 18013-5 and W3C VC data formats
requirements.explanation:
Wallet providers must ensure wallet solutions support PID and EAA 
issued in compliance with Annex II standards (ISO mDL, W3C VC).
requirements.legalText:
Wallet providers shall ensure that wallet solutions support the 
usage of person identification data and electronic attestations 
of attributes issued in compliance with the list of standards 
set out in Annex II.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: Log all transactions including incomplete ones
requirements.explanation:
Wallet instances must log all transactions with relying parties 
and other wallet units, including signing/sealing, regardless of 
completion status.
requirements.legalText:
Irrespective of whether or not a transaction is successfully 
completed, wallet instances shall log all transactions with 
wallet-relying parties and other wallet units, including 
electronic signing and sealing.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: Include mandatory log content (time, RP info, data types)
requirements.explanation:
Transaction logs must include time/date, RP name/contact/identifier/
Member State, data types requested/presented, and reason for 
non-completion if applicable.
requirements.legalText:
The logged information shall at least contain: (a) the time and 
date of the transaction; (b) the name, contact details, and the 
unique identifier of the corresponding wallet-relying party and 
the Member State in which that wallet-relying party is established, 
or in case of other wallet units, relevant information from the 
wallet unit attestation; (c) the type or types of data requested 
and presented in the transaction; (d) in the case of non-completed 
transactions, the reason for such non-completion.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: Ensure log integrity, authenticity, and confidentiality
requirements.explanation:
Wallet providers must ensure integrity, authenticity and 
confidentiality of logged information.
requirements.legalText:
Wallet providers shall ensure integrity, authenticity and 
confidentiality of the logged information.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
legalSourceInfo.description: Wallet integrity, core functionalities, and trust infrastructure

requirements.requirement: Log DPA reports sent via wallet
requirements.explanation:
Wallet instances must log reports sent by the wallet user to data 
protection authorities via their wallet unit.
requirements.legalText:
Wallet instances shall log reports sent by the wallet user to the 
data protection authorities via their wallet unit.

legalSourceInfo.title: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979
